campaign.story:
Mock up of the book. Cover design not finalized.
Coyote and Crow is a tabletop role playing game set in an alternate future of the Americas where colonization never occurred. Instead, advanced civilizations arose over hundreds of years after a massive climate disaster changed the history of the planet. You'll play as adventurers starting out in the city of Cahokia, a bustling, diverse metropolis along the Mississippi River. It's a world of science and spirituality where the future of technology and legends of the past will collide.

The game is created and led by a team of Native Americans representing more than a dozen tribes and we've built a game that both Natives and non-Natives will thrill to explore and build upon.
More than 700 years ago, a bright purple streak shot across the night sky. Over the coming weeks, the Earth fell into a deep winter, the seas raged and ash rained from the sky. The event became known as the Awis. As resources dwindled, winter became longer and summer shorter, people struggled to survive. Wars erupted, people starved, some fleeing their ancestral homes before creeping ice sheets. 
But people survived. Tribes adapted. And in the wake, people began to notice a strange purple mark appearing on people, plants and animals alike. It became known as the Adahnehdi, the Gift, and many took it as a sign that the Great Spirit had not given up on them. 
Eventually, the weather began to ease, the Earth began to heal, and new nations arose. New sciences and technologies, born out of necessity, led to a discovery about the Adahnehdi. It wasn't just a mark, it was a path to abilities and powers, beyond normal human limits. 
The long walk home. Art by Jennifer Lange
Now, 700 years after the world was brought to the brink, a new chapter has begun. Your characters enter a world that is healing but is no less dangerous. The ice sheets are retreating and the seas are calming, but what lay out beyond your borders? The treaties and alliances that made so much sense during the long winters are now eroding and old grudges between nations are not so easily forgotten. New technologies arise almost every day and the rate of change is frightening for some. And then there are the stories. Talk of spirits, monsters, beings of legend. For so many they were just tales to be told around the fire. But now there is talk that these legends may be far more literal than you may have previously believed. Has something awakened them?
the northern continent of Makasing.
Coyote and Crow is an original role playing system built around the exclusive use of D12 dice. Outside of the core rule book, all you'll need to play the game is some pencil and paper and some twelve-sided dice. While there is some complexity to the game, we are striving to present a system that will allow players to refer to the rule book during play as little as possible, keeping most or all of the critical information on your character sheet.
Mock up of the front of a character sheet. Design not finalized.
The basic rule system is centered around collecting a Dice Pool, usually around 5-7 D12s and rolling them to determine either Success or Failure and degree of effect. For example "8" might be the number your Character needs to attempt to do something and every 8 or higher they rolled would be a Success. The more 8's, the more successful they are. 
While combat is a part of Coyote and Crow, the game is actually built around the idea of fighting being only one road to story resolution. The game encourages dialogue, building bridges and finding unique solutions to problems that are not always clearly defined by good and evil. 
Your Characters have Stats like Strength and Spirit and Skills like Investigation and Charm that are modified by their Stats. In addition, when you create your Character, you choose a Path. That Path determines both certain Stat bonuses you receive as well as which Abilities you have access to. Abilities are powers beyond normal human capability, but not at a level where characters would be comparable to superheroes. There are 15 Paths in the core rule book available. In addition, you'll choose an Archetype (Whisperer, Healer, Scout, among others) that will give you Stat and Skill bonuses and a general idea of your character's profession, but will not force your Character too deeply down a specific progression.
Then you'll choose Gifts and Burdens. These allow you to give your Characters specific bonuses or drawbacks and will help you flesh them out in a way that is flavorful and realistic. It's important to note that the rulebook does not dictate whether something is a burden or a gift for a Player. For example, a Player might choose to give their Character a sister. That might be a Burden or a Gift (or both!) depending on how the Player wants their Character to see that relationship.

Sample pages from the equipment chapter. Layouts and content not finalized.

There are no experience points in Coyote and Crow. Instead, it is built on the Legends system. Your Character will have Short Term Goals, which will increase various numbers on your Character sheets or give them new Skills. But you and your group will also have Long Term Goals. When those are completed your legend will grow. You'll write a short story about your adventures, the kind that can be told around the fire for generations to come. These can change your Gifts and Burdens, give you access to new Abilities and more. As you complete more Long Term Goals, your Character's legend will precede them and your stories will spread.

ARCHETYPES
There are six Archetypes in the game, each acting as a starting point for Character development but not constricting their possibilities. Each Archetype has its own symbol. Here are a few of them.
The icons for Warrior, Tinkerer, and Scout (not finalized)


PATHS
In addition to Archetypes, Players choose Paths for their Characters, which are permanent associations they make with an animal and help define what extra human Abilities they'll be able to choose from, among other effects. There are fifteen basic Paths in the core rulebook.
The Path of the Beaver, the Stag and the Spider
(See our Update for more on this)
While this game was created by a Native-led team, this game is for everyone. We've taken great care to craft a game that Natives and non-Natives alike will be able to engage in and find themselves immersed in. 
For Natives, we've crafted both story and game mechanics that will allow you to integrate your own tribal customs into your play. For those who aren't Native, you'll have a wealth of options to choose from as well as clear guidelines for understanding the differences between this world and our real one. 
The game is designed to be your first role playing game or your latest. The core rule book will walk players through every step of how to play Coyote and Crow, but also how to play role playing games in general, including advice on safety and inclusion as well as suggestions on where to find tools outside of the rule book to make your game both easier and more enjoyable.
Everyone involved in Coyote and Crow is deeply passionate about our game and we felt that it was time for Indigenous folks to have a game that didn't see them as secondary, as adversaries, or intertwined with colonialism.
Coyote and Crow is not set in a dystopia. The world went through a dark chapter, but the people of these nations rose to the challenge. There's good food and water, education and meaningful work for almost everyone in Makasing. 
But this world isn't a utopia either. It's place that's growing, where old alliances are strained and past slights are not always forgotten. New technology is putting pressure on old traditions. And with the climate becoming milder, there is a whole world of unknowns out there. On top of all of that, there are rumors that some of the old stories about monsters and spirits might just be a little more real than some originally believed. This is a game where science and the unexplained live side by side and sometimes clash.
The Wanderer. Art by Kyle Charles.

THE CORE RULE BOOK
We are producing a beautiful 300+ page hardbound book, loaded with illustrations and containing all of the rules you'll need to play Coyote and Crow. Included in the book (and PDF) will be:
Detailed history of this alternate world
Descriptions of daily life and culture in Cahokia, the capital of the Free Lands
Rules for creating and advancing your characters, including 6 Archetypes, 15 Paths and 27 Abilities for a massive variety of options
Descriptions and stats for mythical creatures, infamous spirits, shadowy organizations and dangerous cults that can challenge players endlessly
A group of pre-generated characters if you want to jump right into playing the game
A starter adventure, Encounter at Station 54, that can act as a stand alone adventure or as the start of a larger campaign
So much more!
SHIPPING
We will be shipping only to the US and Canada during this Kickstarter. In addition, we will be subsidizing a portion of the shipping costs within the Kickstarter itself to help keep costs down. If you are not in the US or Canada, not to worry. We have already partnered with traditional hobby distribution and the game will be available through your local hobby partners shortly after Kickstarter fulfillment. 
YOUR PLEDGE
 Whisperer: $5  This pledge shows your support for the project and allows you to keep abreast of all the future news about Coyote and Crow. We'll also notify you when late pledges are available after the campaign.
 Tinkerer: $20 With this pledge you get everything the Whisperer gets, plus a full color PDF version of the physical game, including all of the art. This version will be released shortly after we have sent our files to the printer and you'll have access to it before the physical copies have been delivered.
 Warrior: $50 (plus shipping)All of the benefits of both the Whisperer and the Tinkerer plus you'll get one full color hard cover edition and access to all Stretch Goals. You can choose to keep your physical copy of the book or donate it to a reservation library. If you donate, we'll handle the shipping. 
 Healer: $100 All of the benefits of Whisperer, Tinkerer, and Warrior, PLUS we'll ship a full hardcover copy of Coyote and Crow to a Native American reservation library in your honor. You pay for the shipping for your copy and we'll pay for the shipping to the reservation copy.
 Scout: $150 (plus shipping) For Friendly Local Games Stores Only. With this pledge you'll receive 6 copies of Coyote and Crow (1 case). You'll receive these at the same time as other Kickstarter backers, in advance of the general release.
 Seeker: $400 (plus shipping) (ALL GONE) For those that really want to support Coyote and Crow! All of the benefits of the Whisperer, Tinkerer, Warrior and Healer pledges, but your book will be signed and numbered by Connor Alexander. You'll also receive three high quality art prints of art used in the book (which ones, to be determined). This level is limited to 50 backers.
It still hungers. Art by Jeffrey Veregge
We have a diverse team of folks working on this game, most of whom are Native. Additionally, we are striving to bring in other marginalized voices whenever possible. Our team features people from across the LGBTQIA spectrum, including two spirit folks. It's not even a question that this game is political. If you have a problem with a game where there are no people of European descent represented, than this game is probably not for you. That said, we've truly built this game to be played by everyone. It might seem like a big leap, but don't worry, we're going to hold your hand the whole way through and you'll be so happy you stepped off the edge into this vibrant fresh world.
OUR TEAM:
Creator, Designer and Taker of Responsibility in the End: Connor Alexander (Cherokee Nation)
Native Writers and Developers:
Derek Pounds (Samish)
William McKay (Manitoba Metis Federation)
Weyodi Oldbear (Numunu)

Nico Alberts (Cherokee Nation)
Riana Elliott (Cherokee Nation)

Barbara Schelling (Assiniboine)

Elijah Forbes ( Waganakising Odawak)
Jeffery Veregge (S'Klallam)

Brian Roanhorse (Navajo)
Jillian Dolan (Metis/Cree)
Keith Jim (Navajo)
Emma Flowers (Crow)
Native Playtest Leader and Consultant:
Shay Snow (Caddo and Plains Cree)
Non-Native Team Members:
Jade Wesley (Editing)
Jennifer Lange (art)
Amelie Hutt (art)
Janice Sheen (cartography)
Chris Likins (website design)
Heather O'Neill (Kickstarter Management)
*We are continuing to add Native contributors throughout this project's development, so this list is not final.

I'd also like to add that this is a very personal project for me. While it's the first project I've created, I've been working in the games industry for 7 years and I've been a role player since 1978. For a long time I've wanted to create a game that speaks to my Native heritage in a way that's hopeful and positive. I'm proud of the team I've assembled (and am still adding to) and I'm confident that we have the experience, talent and determination to not only complete this project and deliver, but to bring you a truly memorable role playing experience.   - Connor Alexander, creator
$20,000   ✔️ACHIEVED
We'll make every copy of Coyote and Crow with a gorgeous spot UV cover!
$25,000  ✔️ACHIEVED   
We'll include a massive 11" x 17" detailed and annotated map of the city of Cahokia in the core rule book. 
$55,000  ✔️ACHIEVED   
We'll make a character name generator, true to the in game language, Kag Chahi, developed by William McKay. This name generator will be free to access at our website  permanently. Give your characters cool, world accurate names and learn how to come up with your own!
$75,000  ✔️ACHIEVED   
We'll develop a free, rules light,  easy to play downloadable version of Coyote and Crow that will be available to $20+ backers before your book arrives at your door. You'll be able to introduce your auntie to the game ahead of time so she'll have no excuse not to play with you when you get your sweet full version! 

$85,000  ✔️ACHIEVED
All Native Creators get additional bonus.  The success of this campaign has gone far beyond our expectations and we are excited to share the success with our Native creators!  
$90,000  ✔️ACHIEVED
We'll create a Kag Chahi wiki on our website that will allow Natives to add and develop the in-world trade language using an easy system. You'll be part of creating a living language that belongs to all of us! This will be free to access for all players.

$750,000  ✔️ACHIEVED
We'll develop a free mobile app for Coyote & Crow. 
It will include a fully functioning dice app to allow those without physical dice to still be able to play the game.  
It will include the Kag Chahi glossary so players can easily refer to the language of Coyote and Crow. 
It will also be updated with rules clarifications as well as Coyote and Crow news.
$1,000,000 ✔️ACHIEVED
Adventure by Rebecca Roanhorse
We'll partner with award winning Native author Rebecca Roanhorse who will write a one shot adventure for Coyote & Crow. 
Rebecca Roanhorse is a NYTimes bestselling and Nebula, Hugo, and Locus Award-winning speculative fiction writer, having written Black Sun, Star Wars: Resistance Reborn, Race to the Sun, Trail of Lightning and more. 
We'll work to time the release of this digital adventure so that it's ready at the same time as the release of the final PDF version of the game and will be available through multiple sources.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Especially during Covid, many games face delays out of their producers control, from development to printing and shipping. This is my first Kickstarter so I'm surrounding myself with people who know what they're doing. I work in the game industry myself and most of the people on this project are hardened battle veterans. Nevertheless, we may experience delays, but we'll always be as upfront as we can be about them and I'll never compromise on the quality of the product.

If you have questions or concerns about Coyote & Crow, please contact us at coyoteandcrowrpg@gmail.com
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Things are moving at a break neck pace, folks. There’s so much happening that it’s hard for me to summarize it all while also conveying how cool and exciting each of these things is. So, I’m splitting this update into two parts. We’ll talk about the where we’re at with production of everything related to the Kickstarter as well as other news. Then we’ll jump in to more game development discussion.
But first! A quick note! We’ve locked down current orders. Don’t worry, you can still pre-order or make late pledges through BackerKit and we haven’t locked down addresses yet. We’ll do that much later. So if you’re moving or not sure yet where you need your personal book shipped to, you have plenty of time. Also, please fill out your surveys if you haven’t yet. There are still around 1500 of you out there. Don’t make me wag my finger.

Folks, they are here!
A few of you may have already received them and for the rest of you, they'll be sent out in waves over the next few days. If you're new to Kickstarter, you'll be receiving an email from BackerKit, the pledge manager we're working with.  Here's what's in it and what you need to know.

Greetings!
With the campaign officially wrapped and the dust settling, we're finally in a position where we can give you all some news. Happy to report that it's all good stuff!
First, I want to thank all 16,269 of you that backed Coyote & Crow. It was more than just a vote of confidence in our game, it was a clear mandate for us to move forward with taking our RPG and launching a full fledged publishing operation.

We did it folks. In just 30 days we:
Smashed through our 18k original goal in just 45 minutes
Hit all of our original stretch goals in less than a week
Made waves across gaming media
Hit the $1 million+ mark, putting us in the top 6 RPG books of all time
earmarked 5000 books for donations to reservation and tribal libraries, schools and community centers (more on that below)

updates.update_userinfo: What About The Rest of the World? (And our next stretch goal!)
updates.update_content:
Hello again!
Today, I want to talk about a topic that a few people have asked about in a variety of ways. The essence of these questions really boil down to this. What's going on in other parts of the world outside of the Americas in this alternate future? In Coyote & Crow, we focus most closely on Cahokia, our starting city. We touch on the Free Lands and the other nations of Makasing and we'll even briefly outline the nations further south in what we call Abayang and Abazang (South and Central America).

Good morning C&C friends!
We've got just 10 days left in our Kickstarter and I'm getting so excited to announce our last stretch goal later this week if we hit that mark. I'll be able to give you the name and further details on the Native author who will hopefully be writing a one shot adventure for us!
But on to the update. A friend messaged me over the weekend and was already mulling some ideas for a Saga. Saga is what we call a series of adventures or stories, in lieu of campaign, which is often used in role playing games. We felt that campaign came off as too militaristic and we thought Saga worked well with terms like Story and Session, which we also use.

Hey, friends!
I've had a number of folks ask me why we chose to go with the d12 for our system. There's a few reasons and some of them might not be what you think. I thought I'd use my update today to fill you in on some fun trivia. The d12 and the number 12 itself play important roles in both the mechanics and the world building we're doing for Coyote & Crow.

Greetings folks!
Today, I want to talk a little bit about who should be playing this game. I've seen a trickle of concern that Coyote and Crow is something non-Natives shouldn't bring to their table. Before I get into how we've handled this situation in the text of the game itself, I wanted to share my broader thoughts on the topic.

Hey folks,
Just a quick update. Today we hit another tremendous milestone. Thank you all so much for your continued generosity and support. Our whole crew is elated over the response to their work and we're all so excited to finish what we've started.
I also have  a slightly embarrassing situation to address. A very kind person pointed out that our icon for the Warrior was almost identical to the modern icon used in Black Power messaging. This was entirely an error on my part. I used a placeholder mock-up instead of our final icon and we've since remedied that. You can see the actual icon for the Warrior in the current image on the Campaign page. The icon that was there previously was an internal use only illustration that was meant as a developmental reference and was never intended for print.  I apologize to anyone who was confused or concerned, and I truly hope there was no offense caused.  We have the deepest respect for our Black allies and our icon was always meant as a nod to them.

project_data.project_name: Coyote & Crow the Role Playing Game

campaign.story:
About this Project:
This project is my take on extinct creatures! All the dinosaurs and other animals featured will be shown in a fantastical way based on real and popular culture. Like many other artists I've always had a huge affinity for dinosaurs, and while I am no paleo artist, I do my best to do justice to both the realistic and fantasy dinosaurs we know and love. This is a follow up of my Disappear Kickstarter from last year which featured animals recently, and currently extinct, and I thought what better way to follow that up than with dinosaurs! 

How Does it work?
If you are new to kickstarter here is something you should know:
When you back a kickstarter the money is not taken from you right away. It is only taken when the KS is fully funded and AT THE END OF THE TIMER. Which means not until February for this specific kickstarter!
Like most pin Kickstarters the funds go directly into manufacturing and shipping. My last three Kickstarters I made sure to use all funds appropriately and make sure every pin was packaged well and was shipped correctly. The funds go to packing supplies, postage, taxes as well.

Who am I?
I am an enamel pin artist who has been working with pins as an art form for over 8 years. I have designed over 500 pins for various clients all over the world and am well versed in vector design and illustration. I also dabble in children's books from time to time. This is my fourth kickstarter of my own and was the artist for a friends kickstarter.  I hope you will help make it just as successful as the last! 

What about the pins?
All pins will be 2" - 2.5"  for the standard pins; that's why they're a little more pricey than most. Most pin tiers will unlock four pins: A main animal and a glow or special variant, and a mini pin and it's variant, a few tiers later on won't but will be bigger pins. If we unlock all goals more pins will be added until we reach 10 main creatures! Mini pins will be between .5" and 1".
Pins with colored metal or antique metal will be made with soft enamel BUT before you run away, they will be coated in a high quality epoxy to have a smooth finish like hard enamel pins. 
Here is a small sample of the pins I've made:
 NEXT Unlock:


ALL PINS BELOW THIS LINE ARE UNLOCKED
The Jumbo is a $20 Add-on and can be purchased in backerkit if unlocked
The Jumbo is a $15 Add-on and can be purchased in backerkit if unlocked


 Rex body is a +20$ add-on for ALL tiers. This is for the 5" body ONLY. The head is a separate piece and you can add that to your pledge no problem. The total size is roughly 7" combined.
A Previous pin from Disappear 1 featuring antique gold enamel which is featured on all of the antique variants. 


 AND MORE!
Timeline:
Jan. 15th > Kickstarter Begins 
Feb. 20th > Kickstarter Ends/ Funds processed
March 7th/10th Kickstarter Sends Funds and Pins/ Goals Ordered
June Is the tentative ship date for receiving and sending out pins! 

Socials
 https://www.instagram.com/onioncakes/ 
 https://twitter.com/Onioncakes1 
https://www.patreon.com/onioncakes 
https://www.etsy.com/shop/TheOnionCakeStore
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest hurdle to overcome for our kickstarter as well as a problem for many is Covid-19. It affects our daily lives, shipping, making and living. Like my previous Kickstarter I will most likely be shipping these alone or with just my husband. While I gave a generous time frame for the pins to be made please be aware that we will ship as fast as we can. Dates might have to change, this year I've had packages just sitting in customs for weeks and thats an unfortunate fact that we won't know if we have to face it until it gets here.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
It's your old pal, MC Frontalot!
Emphasis on the old. Yep, I came up with Nerdcore Hip-Hop twenty years ago. And for twenty years, people have been asking me to put some of it on vinyl. So now I'm gonna do that.
And you can help me make it happen! Get a copy hot off the press, plus cash in on all the kickstartery incentives that I've cobbled together at the various pledge levels.

The Album
It's a hand-picked selection of my 24 favorite songs that I've ever recorded, on two glorious twelve-inch discs. It is prepped, it is mastered, the extremely cool artwork from Eisner Award winner Gene Ha has been delivered. This thing is ready to go.
SIDE A
Tongue-Clucking Grammarian
Hassle: The Dorkening
Much Chubbier feat. Open Mike Eagle 
Diseases Of Yore feat. Jonathan Coulton 
I'll Form The Head feat. Dr. Awkward and ZeaLouS1 
It Is Pitch Dark
SIDE B
First World Problem
Chisel Down feat. Busdriver and John Roderick 
Charisma Potion
Power User
IWF feat. Miss Eaves, Lex the Lexicon Artist, and E-Turn 
Bad Nerd feat. Corn Mo 
SIDE C
Secrets From The Future
Jacquelyn Hyde
This Old Man
Gold Locks feat. Jean Grae 
Socks On
Stoop Sale
SIDE D
Critical Hit
Spoiler Alert
Origin Of Species
Two Dreamers
Goth Girls
I Hate Your Blog (Unplugged) feat. Quelle Chris 
The Fancy Bonus Stuff
The album comes with a digital version, in every format including FLAC, just in case these days you only buy records to display them proudly in your home.
And at the fancier tiers, check this stuff out:
A metal pin commemorating the album release. I haven't designed it yet! But I've designed such pins before and they're often dope. Lookee:
A limited-edition tee, with Gene Ha's art all over the front of it. On Gildan softstyle in purple heather.
A secret movie screening, where we'll all watch Negin Farsad's Nerdcore Rising documentary together in discord and chat about it throughout. 
A thank-you illustration that I will draw for you using ink and paper, like in the olden days.

A brief theme song that I'll record just for you! Suitable for use as a ringtone, or you can dance to it on TikTok, or I don't know. It's yours. Here's one I made for someone named Steve.

A Certificate of Awesomeness. Indicating that I believe you to be awesome. Suitable for framing.

One item from my personal music history vault! These are precious artifacts that I've been holding on to all these years. The following are available, and I'll cross them off as they are claimed:
Shirt from my very first tour: Nerdcore Rising, 2006 (Medium, 3XL)
Shirt from my very second tour: Secrets From The Future, 2007 (Men's S, M. Ladies' S, XL)
Shirt from my World Tour Of Part Of The East Coast Of Australia, 2013 (XL, 3XL)
A PAX Enforcer longsleeve from 2008. Only PAX Enforcers are supposed to own these. Contraband! I'll sign it.
Neckties from my retired stagewear archive. You can have two! Autographed.
"Booth Lyrics!" These are the little printouts I make and pin to the acoustic foam in the recording booth, one verse at a time. Some have hand corrections or notes on them. All were used to make my songs! Most of Question Bedtime and Net Split are available.
Original composition sketches for the cover of Final Boss. Set of three doodles that I sent to Scott C before he illustrated it.
ALREADY CLAIMED: Prop book featured in the video for Start Over.
ALREADY CLAIMED: Test shirt that I hand-made at the silkscreen workshop in the Mission Cultural Center sometime around 2001. This is the first MCF tee that ever existed. It is a children's XL. 
ALREADY CLAIMED: Ref discs for SFTF, Zero Day, Final Boss, Nerdcore Rising, Solved 
ALREADY CLAIMED: The physical masters for the CDs of Question Bedtime, Secrets From The Future, Final Boss 
ALREADY CLAIMED: The last known copy of my Handmade Demo CDR (v.1.1.14) 
ALREADY CLAIMED: The vinyl test pressing of the d20 double album! 
If you're getting a Vault item, be sure to drop me a note (in Kickstarter) about which ones you like best. First come, first served. 
 A "diamond"-encrusted record player. Diamond is in quotes because they will not be diamonds. Encrusted also probably wants some scare quotes there. I will glue fake diamonds onto the record player and autograph it in silver sharpie. It will have normal outputs, and also bluetooth because technology destroys everything. This is at the Aristocrat pledge level.

LAST-MINUTE STRETCHY GOALS!
[12/29] Hey, this thing has been going great. I love you all very much.
I figure I should throw down a couple of those sweet, sweet stretch goals just in case this last week of the kickstarter wants to go crazy again.

At $28K, The Instrumentals, Mastered
This would be huge, for me, to have instrumentals of every track from every album mastered and ready to go. It will let me:
Perform a much wider variety of material in my streaming concerts and when I'm doing solo live work (someday, again).
Finally put some karaoke tracks together for those who've been asking for them for so many years.
Get more spotify traffic, via those dumb-ass "music to study to" playlists.
Give the instrumentals to you!
So, if we hit $28K, I'll carve out a few thousand bucks for my mastering guy and sic him on the catalog. I'll put the 24 instrumentals that go with d20 into its download package (for the Digital Vinyl support tier and everyone who ordered the vinyl) and I'll put all the instrumentals into another package for everyone who pledged at Deluxe Edition or higher.

At $33K, a New Video
Let's make a very nice music video for any track on d20 that hasn't already had a very nice music video! I'll poll all of you to find out which one we should make.


Thanks.
I'm very keen to get this project rolling! It's something I've wanted to do for a very, very long time. So, thanks for considering the proposition. And double thanks if you find it in your heart & wallet to support it!

Less than three,
mcf
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've structured the tiers so that they will definitely cover production. Covid continues to ravage the planet, but less so in the Czech Republic, where the LPs are getting pressed. So I do not expect any meaningful delays on the albums themselves. Hopefully all the little bonus materials have a very realistic delivery goal too! I'm planning on end-of-Feb or earlier. I'll keep you apprised.

Honestly, the biggest risk is that you won't write me back for thirty weeks to answer my questions about your correct mailing address and tee-shirt size or etc. I remember this problem from my last Kickstarter. But rest assured: I will hassle you about it in a timely fashion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The printing plant says we're on target for early July
updates.update_content:
...so that's good. Not great! But better than, say, August.
I'll have updates for you if anything changes on the vinyl, and I'll post about tracking its progress to California and Massachusetts once it's in motion from the Czech Republic.

Status of your ringtone songs:

Pins, Shirts, Certificates of Awesomeness, Ink Drawings, and Musical History Vault Items went out Feb 27-March 1, so that stuff should be making its way to your mailboxes soon. The US postal service remains SUPER MESSED UP so I will not be very surprised if some of them go into prolonged limbo. But if you're expecting anything on that list, and it gets to the end of March without showing up (and you didn't tell me to hold for the eventual vinyl), please let me know so I can figure it out!
Just picked 'em up! Heading to your mailboxes soon.

updates.update_content:
Consolation concert is this Fri.
Yep, it's the Mea Culpa Livestream where I will do some raps for you, to distract from all the vinyl that you have to unexpectedly wait for. Did your pledge include vinyl? Then your Kickstarter inbox already includes your secret link.
The pins have arrived!

updates.update_userinfo: Vinyl delay, consolation concert, and surveys headed your way
updates.update_content:
I have some lousy news. I negotiated with my manufacturer for two weeks but I couldn’t get anywhere, and they won’t get the vinyl shipped to me until July. July! That’s five months later than I’ve promised you.
This is all my fault. I made my delivery estimate based on turnaround projections from my manufacturer that I'd gotten a few months earlier, and I didn’t re-confirm their dates before constructing the kickstarter. Naturally, in the meantime Covid jacked up their whole production line. I am still amazed at how much it got gummed up over that period, but here I am.

For everyone whose pledge includes the fancy metal pin, here's what it'll look like. I adapted it from the stair railing in Gene Ha's cover illustration, where he hid my initials and the album title. I like it because when it's cut out like this, it looks a little like a medieval flag, but it is actually some wrought iron keeping you from falling down the center of the stairwell! Visual trickery is tight.

I've written them up in the Story on the d20 Kickstarter's main page, but here too I tells ya:

If we get to $28K, I'll hire my mastering engineer to put a professional gloss on the instrumentals for every song from my first seven albums! You'll get a 24-pack of those tracks with the Digital Vinyl and any physical version of the d20 package, and you'll get all 106 tracks with your Deluxe Edition pledge or higher. Plus the whole world gets to listen to them on Spotify, I figure.

updates.update_userinfo: d20 Double Vinyl is funded! New items added to Musical History Vault.
updates.update_content:
Thank you to everyone who hopped on this lil train ride. It's going just peachily!
Interest in the unique items from the Musical History Vault ran pretty high, so I've fleshed out the remainders with some extra stuff: the little lyric sheets I used in the recording booth when I was recording the last couple albums, a prop from a video shoot, my Final Boss cover art doodles, my retired stagewear neckties.

project_data.project_name: D20: Double-Disc Vinyl Retrospective

campaign.story:
Zargoth's Tome of Familiars is a compendium of strange and wondrous creatures -- new familiars, pets, and companions. Each creature is presented like those you would find in a monster manual complete with lore, artwork, and the notes of the infamous demi-lich Zargoth.
Unlike a traditional monster manual, these creatures are each designed not simply as foes to be encountered, but as companions to accompany players on their adventures.


The tome not only includes a myriad of new variant familiars for the find familiar spell, but focuses on creatures that can be taken as pets and companions by any class. These unique pets can be gained through new Feats, to become a core part of a character's identity -- both thematically and mechanically.  
Each new feat gives access to a specific type or family of these new creatures. Some of these categories are very close to the traditional idea of a familiar; the Necromancer feat gives access to a wide variety of undead creatures that can be summoned by the find familiar spell in place of its standard options. Other feats give access to creatures that are very different from the traditional idea of a familiar; the Alchemist feat allows a character to grow strange alien creatures in jars and consume or release them for powerful effects. 
In creating each of these feats and types of companion creatures, balance was as important to us as strong thematic elements. Each familiar has a unique power or ability and can help to define a character at any tier of play, from 1st to 20th level.


Cornered in the alleyway, a ranger backs against the stone wall as shadowy assailants advance. A low growl comes from the unusual dog at her side. She rests her hand reassuringly on its fur, and, in a swirl of blue mist, they are gone, bounding side by side along the city rooftops.
The bonded feat gives a character the ability to form an unshakable bond with a young creature, raising it as their own.
Examples: Blinkdog Pup, Flailing Snailing, Displacer Cub




An artificer clicks a lens over her eye as she turns a delicate mithril tool, making a final adjustment to the ornate clockwork on her workbench. Warm amber light begins to glow in the eyes of her creation, a fox made of gears and sleek silver plates.
The Tinker feat allows a character to use artificer's tools to create clockwork creatures, each with a specific function and the unique ability to transform.
Examples: Quicksilver Fox, Clockwork Spider, Bronzeback Armadillo



A warlock treads carefully on the ancient stones of the tomb, buried beneath burning sands. Behind him walks a cat, its ancient bandages falling away to reveal a white fire in its eyes. In the darkness of the tomb, the ancient guardians recoil in the shadows as the ankh around the cat's neck glints in the pale light of its eyes.  
The Necromancer feat allows characters to use the find familiar spell to raise an undead minion as their familiar.
Examples: Mummified Cat, Floating Skull, Ossuary Hound


The barbarian's cloak unfurls to reveal the arm he had told his companions he had lost in battle -- huge and grotesque, it writhes and pulses, a mass of eyes and gibbering mouths. With a great heave he grips the portcullis, and slowly begins to lift the iron bars.
The Symbiotic Host feat links a character to an aberrant symbiotic creature, granting them great powers at a horrifying cost. 
Examples: Gibbering Arm, Silent Lurker, Spine Worm 




A wizard careful pours a dark bubbling liquid from a glass vial into a strange jar. In the murky liquid of the jar a dark shape floats, suspended in the green fluid. With sudden speed, it darts through the fluid, tentacles and teeth, pressed against the glass.
The Alchemist feat allows a character to use alchemy supplies to grow creatures in jars, creating powerful and dangerous potions.
Examples: Green Ooze, Sanguine Lampreys, Pickled Watcher



In a crowded market, a bard juggles a cascade of brightly colored balls to the cheering of a crowd. Her accomplice, a small, four-armed imp, moves nimbly through the throng,  alighting only to liberate certain treasures; a pearl earring, a gold signet ring, and a coin pouch almost as large as the creature itself.
The Devil's Pact feat enables a character to strike a bargain with a dangerous devil lord, gaining the service -- and vices -- of one of its imps in exchange. 
Examples: Thieving Devil, Feasting Devil, Flayer Devil



We need your help to bring Zargoth's Tome of Familiars to life. Funds acquired during the Kickstarter will go towards making a beautiful, full color, hardcover book. Money will be spent on lavish illustrations and a professional layout, as well as funding the actual printing of the physical books. The more support we can raise, the more content, additional material, and polish we can bring to the finished tome. We want Zargoth's Tome of Familiars to look good on your bookshelf alongside your collection of core books.



UNLOCKED - Monster Sketches. Many of the creatures with alternate forms (a phoenix in its egg, a mechanical fox that can transform into a sword, a parasitic aberration that latches onto a host) will be given alternate art sketches to enhance their full color illustrations.
UNLOCKED  - Bonded Race. We will include an all new race that begins the game bonded to a powerful familiar that shares their soul.
UNLOCKED - Magic Items. We will add a section of magic items, specifically designed to interact with the familiars in this book. Includes artwork.
$35,000 - Artificer’s Dungeon.  We will create a small dungeon adventure, featuring a selection of our creations. A digital version of this will be given to all backers at every pledge level!


 Eugene Fasano is the founder and lead designer at Arcana Games, who has received acclaim for his Ennie award winning mythological setting for 5e, Arkadia. He has published over thirty best selling RPG titles, including half a dozen licensed adventures for Dungeons and Dragons such as Trouble in Waterdeep, featured in Wizards of the Coast’s Dragon+ Magazine.
 Masha Lepire has produced over two dozen games and game related projects. They are also an award winning game designer and have been a panelist at PAX West, Norwescon, and GeekGirlCon. When they're not petting cute animals, they work on VR experiences at Oculus.
Ken Roberts is an award winning writer and designer. He has worked closely with Arcana Games, developing and publishing adventures for Blood and Bone and officially licensed material for Wizards of the Coast’s Dungeons and Dragons.
Natan Bolnick has worked worked closely with Arcana Games to develop games for three years. He has spent over fifteen years creating content, running games, and playing Dungeons and Dragons.
Xabi Gazte is a fantasy illustrator and animal loving pirate. He started his career working as a colorist and cover artist for fantasy comic books and later he made the jump to making art for TTRPGs, board games, and trading card games, loving the fantasy theme as much as his first day.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Arcana Games has completed half a dozen successful Kickstarters, including our ENNIE award wining setting for 5e, Arkadia.

The greatest risk is potential printing and shipping delays due to the pandemic. Even if we see delays on this front, the books design and art are near to completion and backers will still receive the PDF in a timely fashion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Zargoth's Tome of Familiars PDF Release
updates.update_content: Zargoth's Tome of Familiars is here! PDF's have been sent to all backers for download from DrivethruRPG. We are in the process of submitting the digital files for proofing so that we can get the hardcovers in your hands as soon as possible. This process generally takes about a month between the files getting approved for print, the actual printing time, and then the physical proofs being shipped out and arriving for inspection and approval. We will likely ship the hardcovers in July and you can expect them to arrive by late summer.

updates.update_userinfo: Zargoth's Tome of Familiars Release Update
updates.update_content: The Tome is nearly complete! All artwork and writing for the book is finished, and editing is underway. Once the layout is complete PDFs can be sent right away. Myself and our project manager had the fortunate privilege of getting our vaccines this month, which took us out of commission for bit and has set things back by about a week. We're still shooting for a release at the end of May, or in the next several weeks at the latest.

Greetings adventurers! Our team has been hard at work on the tome and we're happy to announce that the writing and artwork for the book are almost complete. Once they wrap up, we can move on to editing and layout, putting us right on track for a May release. The PDF will be made available as soon as it is ready, with the print copies shipping up to a month later, depending on proofing and printing times.

The reward surveys have been sent out for all backer tiers! You have received an email from Kickstarter prompting you for the information we will need to send you your rewards. Please fill out the information and let us know if you have any questions about the process.

We will soon be releasing the first wave of playtest materials to eligible backers ($80 tier and above). Details on when this material will be available and how to access it will follow in a near-future update exclusive to those reward tiers.

We made it! With your help, the quest is complete and your reward... is Zargoth's Tome of Familiars! Thank you for supporting our project. The bulk of the funds we have raised will go to making more awesome artwork and getting the book printed.

In the next couple weeks Kickstarter should process the funds from the campaign. Once this is complete, we will send a backer report (you will receive an email notification via Kickstarter) that will ask for all the relevant details we need to ship your reward. That is also the time we will start to release playtest materials to eligible backers.

With under one day left, we've just reached our stretch goal for magic items. The book will contain an illustrated section of magic items that relate to the familiars in the book. Thank you so much for your support!

We are not accepting late pledges, this is it!
If you have been following the project and are considering backing, now is the time.

updates.update_userinfo: Less Than 24 Hours Left! Magic Item Stretch Goal Unlocked!
updates.update_content:
With under a week to go we have just reached the 20k mark with our next stretch goal (magic items for you and your familiar) on the horizon at 25k!

We've included a sneak peek at Xabi Gazte's latest illustrations for the Tome: Sylvan Keeper companions, strange and majestic plant-animals from the Fey Wilds.

We've reached our second stretch goal, the Bonded Race! The book will now include an all new race that begins the game bonded to a powerful familiar that shares their soul. This stretch goal will be available to backers at every tier. Backers at the Conjurer ($80) tier and above will be given exclusive playtest access once the Kickstarter concludes to help us tune and polish the race.

campaign.story:
We're excited to present new items we've been working on, based on feedback from thousands of customers and Kickstarter backers. 
The campaign is ending today, September 10.
Now's your last chance to get your pledges in!
Orders are planned to ship in three months, about mid-December.
1. Neoprene Playmats to make any flat surface a quality gaming table.
2. Premium Bags for taking several options to game night with great style and protection.
2. Lightweight Bags as a smaller sized option, meant for quick trips or a short night with friends.
4. 2021 Weekly Desk Calendar with 53 beautiful board game photos taken by members of the community.
The Playmat is a premium play surface designed with the help of over a thousand gamers who participated in surveys and provided insightful feedback.
Whether you're a casual or diehard gamer, there's no doubt this will elevate gaming experiences for you and your friends and family, at home or on the go.
Based on survey data, it will come in two sizes:
 3 x 5 ft (91 x 152 cm)
 3.5 x 5.5 ft (107 x 168 cm)
The smaller size will fit on 75% of your tables and the larger size will fit on 45% of your tables. These two options should be a good balance between fitting on as many tables as possible, while giving you as much room to play as possible.
As an added bonus, the small size will fit in the play area of our affordable and available-for-purchase Jasper Board Game Table, and the large size is the same size as the Jasper's dining topper.
Extra Thick Padding
         Our premium Playmat is 5mm thick, a noticeable improvement over typical 3mm options. This makes it closer to a real gaming table feel designed to elevate your tactile experience. It's not just a pretty backdrop.
Inset Edge Stitching
         The edge stitching really takes the Playmat from basic material to a fine product. We've also made sure the stitching has a lower profile than the rest of the mat, so it won't catch cards if they slide to the edge.  
No-Slip Rubber Backing
         Few things are worse than a board sliding across the table and pieces falling to the floor. We've tested this. Trust us. The Playmat won't be sliding anywhere.
Every Playmat will come with a carrying case specifically designed for it. We want it to go with you to a friend's house, a community game night, a con, or a weekend getaway.
I'm always a little skeptical of "gift-with-purchase" items companies use to increase interest, so it was important this wasn't just a cheap add-on. We've made sure the quality of the case matches the quality of the mat. The Playmat slides into the case easily and the adjustable straps make it comfortable to carry. We bet you'll end up using it even more than you think!
Why do I need a board game bag, you ask? We agree you could use a small grocery bag or precariously bungee-cord a big stack of games together - but wouldn't you and your games feel much safer with something made exclusively for them?
When we first launched these bags, we had no idea just how much you'd love them and how important they'd be. From going over to a friend's house or even traveling (yes, this will happen again!), having a durable and padded bag has saved countless boxes getting lost or ruined and pieces exploding all over the floor or car. Now, with a bunch of real-life product testing, the Premium Bag is even better with upgraded shoulder straps and limited-edition colors.
Durable water resistant exterior with reinforced seams 
Rubber feet
Heavy padding on all six sides
Multiple compartments
Tough metal zippers 
Several options for different carrying methods
Different situations (or hand cramps) call for different transport methods, so your new Premium or Standard bag is built for several options.  You can wear it as a backpack, secure it to your luggage, or carry it the good old fashioned way. The backpack straps even hide under the luggage handle slip so that everything is tucked away when you aren't using them.
Premium Bag Bonus: A removable shoulder strap with heavy-duty metal parts and a padded strap.
One of the most popular requests  was to add more colors and we definitely agreed, so here they are: Ruby Red and Fern Green. These are limited edition colors so if you like them, now's the time to get them!
Please note, Heather Blue bags are not available in Europe for this campaign.
You're only as good as your weakest link, so they say. And whoever "they" are, they're probably right.
Which is why we're adding all metal parts to the Premium Bag. Now, the weight capacity has increased and you can be certain that you'll be able to carry any ambitious packing list.
Plus, doesn't metal just look way better, and well, more premium?
Metal parts!
The Premium and Standard Bags are both the same shape, but the main differences are the upgraded materials, colors, carrying options, and weight capacity.
 Fabric & Colors: Premium bags are made with a high-end soft-touch blue, red or green fabric. Standard Bags are made of a basic woven fabric and are only available in grey.
 Carrying Options: Premium bags offer a heavy-duty and removable shoulder strap. 
 Weight Limits: Premium Bags are rated at 65 pounds for every carrying method while the Standard Bag handle is rated at 50 pounds for the handle and the backpack straps at 40 pounds.
**Upgrade: The premium bags have been upgraded from our previous bags. They now have metal clasps and clips instead of plastic.** 
"Chad really listened to his customers and his reviewers and went back to the drawing board and redesigned it and you can tell he is also a game player because he made the perfect game bag. Price point - perfect. The quality - for what it is, for what it does - it's a spot-on perfect."
Sometimes you don't need everything our Premium and Standard bags have to offer, so we're excited to launch a completely new and very affordable companion product, the Lightweight Bag.
It has the solid construction of our Premium and Standard offerings but is a bit smaller.
Folds flat
Dual-layer water resistant fabric exterior
Wraparound handle straps to fully support game boxes
I realized I needed this because grocery bags aren’t built for games. The proportions aren't right for games to fit comfortably, no lid meant everything falling out in the car, there was no protection from light rain, and they weren’t built for the weight.
I also felt it wasn't quite appropriate to bring a big imposing bag when going to dinner with friends and they asked me to bring over "just a couple of games". 
Priced at only $6, its dollar-to-value ratio will definitely impress you!
Note on weight limits: The Premium, Standard and Lightweight bag weight limits are based on factory testing. These bags are made for board games not for bricks, gold bars, or dirty laundry, so please use them responsibly. Weight limits also may vary depending on the weight distribution and how the bag is handled.
Our 2020 Weekly-View Calendar was a huge hit (little did we know how many board games we'd actually end up playing) so we're bringing it back for 2021 with updated photos.
This is a feature-packed calendar that will include weekly gaming prompts, gamer profile cards, full year overview, 10x10 Challenge, weekly tracker, habit tracker, and space for notes.
Have you seen some great board game photos that should be in the calendar? Recommend a specific photo (with link to original photo and/or photographer profile) in the comments section and we'll choose some photos to include! (assuming the photographer is on board).
It's basic business that if you're using someone's work, they should get paid. All photographers will be paid a royalty based on a percentage of calendar sales and will receive a free calendar. Each photo will say the name of both the photographer and game. 
Anytime before your items ship, you may cancel your order for a full refund, no questions asked.
And when you do get your items, if you don't think what you ordered lives up to expectations, we'll also refund you 100% and even pay for return shipping.
We are quite confident you should receive your items by the end of December, before Christmas. There's also the possibility that, depending on your order, our inventory and fulfillment speed, you may receive your items as early as October (We'll caffeinate our elves and try our best!).
No additional duty or taxes will be due when your rewards are delivered to US, Canada, UK & European Union, and Australia locations.
Friendly shipping means your package will ship from your own country or region. This is done to expedite delivery and eliminate taxes and fees.
US Friendly Shipping
EU/UK Friendly Shipping (Will ship from Germany)
Australia Friendly Shipping
Canada Friendly Shipping
Do not manually increase your pledge amount to pay for the shipping now.
Shipping will be collected after the campaign in the Pledge Manager. You will get an email and an update from us after the campaign with instructions for the Pledge Manager. If you pay for shipping now, it will make things much more complicated during the Pledge Manager.
BoardGameTables.com was founded in 2014 by me, Chad DeShon. I'm a gamer who wanted a nice table for playing board games and figured other people might as well.
Now, in addition to selling high quality custom board game tables, BoardGameTables.com also sells a less expensive, some-assembly-required, solid wood table called The Jasper Board Game Table, and a line of quick but deceptively strategic board games.
We started selling board game bags for a similar reason. I needed something to carry my games in. No off-the-shelf options worked for me. They were too big, too small, or not protected enough.
I published a board game calendar back in 2011, simply as a hobby, and sold 100. It was the first time I sold a product online, and it planted a seed of things to come; starting a business that would serve the board gaming community.  It's so rewarding to still be doing that.
First: Choose the pledge level you want.
Second: If you want to buy lightweight bags or calendars, you will need to manually increase the price to pay for those.
Add $6 to your pledge for every lightweight bag.
Add $14 to your pledge for every calendar.
You can also add additional regular/premium bags or small/large playmats by adding $29/$46/$59/$69 to your pledge for each.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this Kickstarter consists of several different products, I am confident we can deliver them on time. Of course international shipping and COVID bring a certain amount of uncertainty to any project, but we have done our best to prepare and add extra padding to the schedule to account for this.

All the product designs are final (except we are still choosing some calendar photos, so send suggestions). The bags and calendars are made by factories we have used before. We are using fulfillment centers that we have used for previous Kickstarter projects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Three quick things here.
Account Name Change
We’re going to be switching our Kickstarter account name from “Chad DeShon” to “BoardGameTables.com”. Chad is still the owner, and everything business related is the same, we just think it makes a bit more sense for the Kickstarter account to be named after the company.

Europe
Almost all of the products have been shipped. For the others who were waiting since our last update, restrictions have finally been lifted, but there is a continental backlog of products for shipping services to get through. We're sending the last products out for delivery now and hope you'll get them soon!

We still have 183 rewards to deliver to European backers.
Because of new COVID restrictions, we are not able to ship DHL packages with any side over 40cm from our fulfillment center in Germany to Ireland, Czech Republic, Belgium, Italy, Greece or the UK. We are not able to ship any packages to France.
What does 40cm have to do with COVID? Well, they didn't really tell us. But I think it has to do with capacity. COVID precautions mean work is getting done slower. Ecommerce and holiday craziness means more packages are being shipped now than ever before. Large packages take more work to ship. So this is a way to throttle the crazy.

The original Kickstarter estimate for this campaign was December 2020. We are still on target for that except for a few European backers who ordered red bags.
United States
Everything has shipped and has had enough time to get to you. The only exception to this is people who filled out their pledge manager late and ordered a small playmat. Those orders shipped out today.

Clear off those tables!
Many of your items are being shipped as we speak, so clear off your tables and make space for your new Playmats!
Please note that you may receive items in multiple packages at different times.

Finalize Your Pledge
Your Pledge Manager is up and ready for you to complete your orders! Check your emails as soon as you can and fill out your Pledge Manager so we know where to ship. This must be completed to receive what you ordered. We're working hard to get these to you before Christmas!
Your Pledge Link

Thank You!
The campaign has wrapped up and we're so thankful for the 5,700+ backers who have participated.
Playmats! Bags! Calendars! We're working on getting them to you as quickly as possible.

6 Simple Dollars
Like a movie, this Kickstarter has its stars: the luxuriously thick Playmat and the Premium bags that now come in three colors.
But the Oscar for "Best Product in a Supporting Role" goes to this guy:

project_data.project_name: Playmats and Bags for Board Games

campaign.story:
“Every individual matters. Every individual has a role to play.” – Jane Goodall
There are doors a hulking orc warrior can bash open in a single blow that would take a party of kobolds a month to chisel through and there are priceless artifacts that a goblin catburglar can swipe without a sound that an army of dwarves would have a great deal of trouble acquiring. Our differences make us strong.
With the Stonehaven Adventurers 2020 project, we are creating a variety of adventuring parties. Some will include variations of a single fantasy race, others will be a mix of different fantasy races. The parties will not all include the same number of miniatures becuase of the difference in the cost of production due to size, and not all of the parties will be included in the Core Set. Some are only available as add-ons.
The miniatures will be made in the USA. They will be cast in 100% lead free pewter (or polyurethane resin in the case of the dragon) and some assembly will be required. They will be sculpted on the standard 28 mm scale. Slotted round bases will be included with miniatures that are pictured on round bases.
And now we present the Core Set:
Pictured from top to bottom, left to right: Grippli Warrior ($4), Grippli Samurai ($4), Kobold Archer ($5), Half-Dragon Wizard ($7), Pygmy Lizardfolk Rogue ($5)
Cold Blood Clan! Though they come from disparate backgrounds, these heroes have been bound together by cruel circumstance. Finding themselves aboard a prison vessel bound for the quicksilver mines, they combined their strengths, made their escape,  and discovered that they weren't so different after all. (Want another one?Add-on cost: $25)
Pictured from top to bottom, left to right: Male Human Hedgemage ($6), Male Human Thief ($7), Male Human Dagger Hobo ($7), Male Half-Elf Fighter ($6), Female Half-Elf Swashbuckler ($6)
These scavengers follow the great armies, stealing gear, treasure, and other supplies from the casualties of war. They are not above creating a few extra casualties in order to "find" a few more treasures! (Want another one? Add-on cost: $25)

Pictured from top to bottom, left to right: Male Human Blademaster ($8), Female Human Monk ($5), Male Human Monk ($8), Male Human Bard ($7), Male Human Jester ($6)
Lord Rhatagon's players travel from town to town, performing for the peasants and generally distracting from the privations of peasant life. Each has their own past that they are running from, but none moreso than Rhatagon himself, who travels with his minstrels seeking to rebuild the honor of his house. (Want another one? Party add-on cost: $25)



Pictured from left to right, top to bottom: Male Goblin Necromancer ($4), Male Goblin Monk ($4), Female Goblin Witch ($4), Male Goblin Taskmaster ($4), Male Goblin Warrior ($4), Female Goblin Rogue ($4), Female Goblin Ranger ($4)
Goblins seldom get the chance to determine their own destinies. They are the pawns of greater powers and are seen as vermin by the "civilized" races. But just as men can surely be evil, goblins can surely be good. (Want another one? Party add-on cost: $25)
Pictured from left to right, top to bottom: Male Tengu Rogue ($6), Male Dwarven Cleric ($7), Male Halfling Trickster ($5), Male Dwarven Guard ($6), Male Tiefling Geomancer ($6)
The Doublecreek Watch has had its hands full lately with escaped convicts, charlatans, and would-be heroes running around stirring up trouble! It's going to be one zany adventure, culminating in the wacky awakening of ancient horrors! (Want another one? Party add-on cost: $25)


Pictured from top to bottom left to right: Female Tiefling Ranger ($6), Male Half-Orc Ronin ($7), Male Gnome Swashbuckler ($4), Male Human Lordling  ($9), Male Human Mad Scientist ($6)
This adventuring party is still forming up and they have yet to even pick a name for themselves, but soon enough one would be chosen for them! They are at the inn though, and Cyragnome is swirling his fancy wine, just itching for a fight when this 7-foot tall human lording carrying a battleaxe walks in, demanding the best room in the place. That's the very room where Cyragnome is planning to stay! What will happen next??!!
. . . I'll tell you! As the common room fills up with merchants and laborers, a few more faces stand out to Cyragnome: A man carrying a strange contraption who talks loudly about it's enormous value, an overconfident tiefling with a long bow, and a gang of half-orcs who are clearly working themselves up to some violence. 
In addition to the Core Set, we've got some other stuff that is only available as add-ons. This is that stuff!

Pictured from top to bottom, left to right: Male Orc Fighter ($9), Female Orc Cleric ($9), Female Orc Archer ($9), Male Orc Wizard ($9), Male Orc Warrior ($10)
The massive mountain Orcs have formed an uneasy alliance with the mountain queen. Orc warriors, once feared and killed on sight, are now commonplace among the caravan guards and mercenary companies that come down from the northern steppes. (Party add-on cost: $37)
The Mushroom Folk have lived under the dark trees for as long as time has been counted. Mercurial creatures, they can change their form to best suit the needs of the coming day. Although many will prefer to maintain a single form, others will change form each night: from simple form to warrior form, or from spore form to mage form. Each form has its strengths and drawbacks.
The Mushroom Folk have interchangeable parts and can be assembled into thousands of different combinations. 
Pictured from left to right: Seedy ($5), Mushroom Sporeling with Leaf Scroll ($6), Mushroom Warrior with Hammer ($8), Mushroom with Bean Blade ($6), Mushroom with Sweetgum Mace ($6)
Add-on: Mushroom Folk Subset A  (Party add-on cost: $25)
 Pictured from left to right: Mossling ($5), Mushroom with Beanbow ($6), Mushroom Snail Rider ($9), Mushroom Mage with Crystal Staff ($6), Mushroom with Maple Blade ($6)
Add-on: Mushroom Folk Subset B  (Party add-on cost: $25)
Pictured from left to right: Carrote ($6), Mushroom Druid with Oak Club ($6), Mushroom with Blowgun ($6), Mushroom Mage with Seedy Staff ($6), Mushroom with Thorn Daggers ($6)
Add-on: Mushroom Folk Subset C  (Party add-on cost: $25)
Pictured from left to right: Vinesnake ($6), Mushroom Warrior with Slate Sword ($8), Mushroom Sporeling with Satchel ($6), Mushroom Mage with Moon Staff ($6), Mushroom Druid with Briar Club ($6)
Add-on: Mushroom Folk Subset D  (Party add-on cost: $25)



Pictured from Left to Right: Porcupinecone ($4), Mutoe ($5)(Locked), Mushroom Warrior with Axe ($8), Mushroom Mage with Seed Fan ($6), Mushroom Sporeling with Stick ($6)
Add-on: Mushroom Folk Subset E  (Party add-on cost: $25)
Mushroom folk unlocked by stretch goals will be added to the Mushroom Folk Set.
The Reclining Dragon rests comfortably on your tabletop, awaiting delicious adventurers to walk into its jaws. Or you could barter with it, or whatever, he's pretty chill that way! 
This dragon is big! It measures 105mm across and will be cast in polyurethane resin. The wings come unattached. (Add-on cost: $25)
As we hit these stretch goals, more miniatures will be added to the Core Set, Mushroom Set, and/or made available as add-ons!
First up:

We reached $12,000! Cyragnome the gnomish swashbuckler will be added to the Core Set. He will also be available as a $4 add-on. Cyragnome is a fearless fighter with a flair for the dramatic. Many a bandit has had his knees bloodied by Cyragnome's flashing blade!

We reached $14,500! the Male Goblin Warrior will be unlocked and added to the Otker and the Mob adventuring party in the Core Set. He will also be available as a $4 add-on. Goblin warriors are fearless in battle. Often facing much larger foes, they often triumph through a combination of lucky crits and really bad attack rolls from lvl 1 adventurers!

We reached $17,000! The Female Goblin Ranger will be unlocked and added to the Otker and the Mob adventuring party in the Core Set. She will also be available as a $4 add-on. Ricochet the goblin ranger got her nickname by bouncing a bolt off a guard's shield and into another guard's exposed back. 

We reachd $19,500! The Male Human Mad Scientist will be added to the Core Set and will be available as a $6 add-on. He's been tinkering with that handheld lightning cannon for years and he's reasonably sure it won't explode when fired . . . well, pretty sure any way. I mean, he wouldn't just be carrying it around like that with his finger on the trigger and everything unless he'd tested it first. Right?


We reached $20,000! The Female Tiefling Ranger will be added to the Core Set and will be available as a $6 add-on. Tieflings are universally mistrusted and occasionally feared, but Sen has tried hard to do the right thing, though it has often enough lost her both wealth and friends. Maybe she just never had the right friends?

We hit $20,750! The Mushroom Warrior with Axe will be added to the Mushroom Set and will be available as an $8 add-on. This guy means business. Warrior form is inherently tougher than the other forms, and mushroom folk will often take this form if they know a fight is coming in the next few days. 

We reached $22,000! The Male Human Lordling has been unlocked and added to the Core Set and available as a $9 add on. The Lordling is still very much trying to prove himself to his father. He's not really a bad person, just self-centered, priveledged, and full of the overconfidence of youth.
We reached $22,500! The Mutoe will be added to the Mushroom Set and will be available as a $5 add-on. To create a mutoe, a mushroom person must carefully carve the figure as a single piece from a living oak tree. The final stroke of the carving blade separates the mutoe and imbues it with the consciousness of the oak tree from which it was cut.

We hit $23,275! The Mushroom Mage with Seed Fan will be added to the Mushroom set and will be available as a $6 add-on. This wind mage carries the chosen weapon of his order, using it to strengthen the summoning of his gales and dustdevils. 

We hit $23,877! The Male Half-Orc Ronin will be added to the Core set and will be available as a $7 add-on. He's not a real samurai. He's clearly part of the peasant class, and everything from his accent to his brutal fighting method give him away as a fraud. You'd be a fool to say it to his face though!

We reached $24,500! The Spore with a Stick will be added to the Mushroom Set and will be available as a $6 add-on. Spore Form is ideal for travel, carrying messages, or for fleeing combat. When mushroom folk are defeated in combat, they revert to this form. 
We reached $25,000! The Mushroom Druid with Glaive (Octopus Stinkhorn Head!) will be added to the Mushroom Set and will be available as a $6 add-on. "Old Devil's Fingers" they called him. But he showed them. He showed them all . . . by being really kind to everyone!
Wow! You scrolled so far! Thanks for taking the time you check out our project; you are the best!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Covid 19 continues to introduce new challenges to our lives. Because of this, are doing everything we can to ensure that the production of these miniatures goes smoothly. 

As of project luanch, our manufacturers (located in the USA) have been able to return to work, but that could change. We have only included miniatures in this project where the initial sculpting is already completed, but the production of the miniatures could well be delayed by factors outside of our control, including Covid-19. We will do our best to deal with these situations as they arise, but we are committed to making these minis and getting them to our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The majority of our miniatures will be cast in lead-free pewter, which won't corrode, tarnish, or rust. While the metal is easily re-used, objects made from pewter are sill around from the bronze age, almost 3000 years ago.

updates.update_content: MINIS!

Whelp. Bad news first. My original timeline was based on past projects which usually only involved one production mold per mini, but the extra parts of the mushroom folk have made this a 100+ part Kickstarter with 100+ production Molds. This means that the Core Set will likely be ready to ship a few weeks later than planned, and the rewards including the Mushroom Set and Orc Set will ship a few weeks later. I was so excited to have stuff early this time too!

campaign.story:
Saint Louis, Missouri, 1920. Prohibition, the Constitutional ban on the sale of alcohol in the United States, comes into effect.... And business couldn't be better at the Little Daisy Cafe.
But things aren't what they seem. Atlas May, proprietor, uses the charming little restaurant as a front for his real cash cow; the Lackadaisy speakeasy, where flashing the club symbol from a deck of cards grants everykitty in-the-know access to more moonshine than they could ever drink. Life is good... Until Atlas is murdered in cold blood.
Now, it's 1927. Mitzi, Atlas' widow, struggles to keep Lackadaisy afloat, as the patrons drift away and a skeleton crew of staff sticks by her side. Scrappy young musician/rum-runner Rocky Rickaby, his wide-eyed but tightly-wound cousin Freckle McMurray, and the endlessly resourceful and sharp-tongued Ivy Pepper, heiress to the quickly-dwindling Lackadaisy fortune, are forced to make do in a world of increasingly unfriendly competition, intent on shooting, smuggling, and conspiring their way back to a successful bar, against all odds. 
Lackadaisy Cats has been running online since 2006, immersing its readership in a world of sepia-toned crime, adventure, action, and comedy. And now, it's ready for its next big move... to a screen near you.
Why a cartoon? Why now?
There's never been more interest in adult animation, with shows like Bojack Horseman, Big Mouth, and Primal capturing the attention and imaginations of millions of viewers. 
Lackadaisy is an exceptional webcomic, but in her mind, Tracy has always pictured it as an animated film. It’s a side effect, perhaps, of a childhood nourished on Looney Tunes, Disney, and Don Bluth features; a dream of sharing that living, breathing, musical version of Lackadaisy with its dedicated readership. But the when-and-how something like that could ever be achieved has always lacked an obvious ingress.
As the 20s dawn upon us again, with new animation tools and techniques available, with talented and excited artists on deck an raring to get to work, and with the internet eager for more independently-created media, the auspiciousness seems writ-large - splashed across an art deco picture palace marquee, if you will. 
Now’s the time.
The Lackadaisy animated short proposes a 10-minute, fun-and-action-filled adventure, full of car chases, shootout, sass, and  un-requested violin solos. And with your help, we can make it happen!
The finished short will be available for everyone to watch!
Meet the people in charge of (and contributing to) the project! 
A former game dev, illustrator and graphic designer, Tracy Butler began Lackadaisy after researching the history of her century-old Saint Louis home, and being inspired by her love of jazz music and 1920s aesthetics. Boasting over 1,600 backers on Patreon, Lackadaisy has been her full-time job for years, garnering a dedicated readership of thousands. As the creator of the comic, Tracy will play a role as co-director on the animated short, as well as overseeing art direction.
Fable Siegel is a veteran animation professional, boasting a resume that includes Titmouse, Starburns, the internet phenomenon Hazbin Hotel, and two Game Grumps Animated shorts, along with storyboard work for Cartoon Network (Ben 10), Stoopid Monkey (Adam Ruins Everything: Reanimated History), Warner Brothers (Wacky Races), Shadow Machine (F is for Family), and more, as well as being a board artist, animator, and designer for Six Point Harness (Like Share Die).  Brought onto the Lackadaisy animated short as a production manager, director, and producer, they'll be overseeing the project utilizing their years of professional experience and skill.
 Our awesome line-up of talent, in no particular order:
 Michael Kovach  (@kovox) as Rocky Rickaby! 
 Belsheber Rusape (@BelRusapeVO) as Calvin "Freckle" McMurray! 
 Lisa Reimold (@lisareimold)  as Ivy Pepper! 
 Ashe Wagner (@TheQueenViking)  as Mitzi May! 
and SungWon Cho (@ProZD) as Mordecai Heller! 
Character Design
Tai (@corvidmonster)
3D Modeling
Zachary "Newt" Nall (https://www.noneuclideandesigns.com/)
Storyboard Artist
Ashley "Kilomonster" Green (@AshGMonstrology)
Sound Direction
M. Gewehr (@MWGewehr)
Theme Music
Sepiatonic (https://www.facebook.com/sepiatonic/)
Violinist
Ameryln Zeta (@amenemone)
Wondering what awards await you if you decide to back the project? Look no further!
Lackadaisy Essentials is the primary means by which we intend to fund the animated short, and Iron Circus Comics' part in this incredibly ambitious project! Planned as a hardcover volume of about 100 pages, Lackadaisy Essentials contains never-before-published minicomics, one-offs, sketches, and other creative work by Tracy, delving into the world and details of the Lackadaisy webcomic.
 Lackadaisy Volumes 1 & 2 ebooks are the collected Lackadaisy webcomic! Grab the tiers including this reward to read the comic offline at your leisure, at a beautiful, high resolution!
Want to see the finished product in its snazziest, most high-quality form? Back a tier that grants access to an HD download of the finished animated short! The Lackadaisy short will be a fully-polished final product, professionally animated, voice-acted, and scored by musical and animation professionals!
 There's so much that goes into making a cartoon. Storyboards, animatics, a soundtrack, 3D models! Back at the Goodie Bag level and higher to grab all these cool bits 'n' pieces. The perfect backer level for folks who wanna see how the sausage is made. Higher levels even grant special thanks in the credits!
 ALL IN! Really wanna become an indispensable part of the project? Maybe even make animation history? The very highest tiers of support grant in-story cameos, personalized Lackadaisy-sona designs, original art from Tracy and the crew, and MORE. 
 There's something available at practically every level of support!
 $85,000 is the minimum we would need to make sure this one-of-a-kind project comes to fruition. But in case we overfund, we already have some awesome plans to make this Kickstarter even better.

And our final two stretch goals...

Whatever you may decide, thanks for getting this far down the page, and reading all about this new venture! We hope to see you on the other side in 2021, with the very first Iron Circus Animation!
