updates.update_content:
I'm happy to say that the loot decks have shipped a bit earlier than I expected! It sounds like some of you have received yours already. At this point it is up to the printing service and the shipping companies to deliver them, so I hope they all arrive soon.
Deckbuilding Guide

I received the most recent prototypes from the new printing company a week ago, and they look great. Much higher quality than the earlier prototypes. Since then I have been doing some final proofreading and setting everything up within their system to prepare for production. Everything is ready to go at this point, and I will submit the final order within the next few days after giving everyone a bit of time for last minute address changes. From there the printing company will ship your cards directly to you!
Address Changes

I apologize, it has been too long since my last update! Not too much of excitement has happened yet, but things are progressing on my end.
A New Printer
I have moved to a new printing service after discovering some quality issues that concerned me with the company I had planned to use (see my last update). This was very annoying, but the good news is that the new company seems much better and your cards will be higher quality without defects.

I sent out surveys to everyone today, and have updates on the production process and pre-orders.
Surveys
I sent the surveys a few minutes ago, so you should be able to fill those out now. The surveys exist so that you can give me your address for shipping the loot cards and specify which items and add-ons you pledged for. They should be pretty painless, but of course let me know if you have any questions!

We did it! Thank you so much to everyone who backed. I'm incredibly excited that I get to bring this project to life for everyone and not just hog all the loot cards for myself. We vastly exceeded my funding expectations, hitting the funding mark in the first 24 hours and knocking out a bunch of stretch goals throughout the campaign.
What's Next?

I have a few updates on shipping now that the project is nearing its conclusion, including good news for Canadians.
Shipping to Canada
I have run the numbers again for Canada and it looks like I will be able to get the shipping down to approximately $16. This means, with the shipping cost that is included in the price, I can get the shipping price you pay down to $12 as opposed to the $20 that Kickstarter currently tells you it will cost. So, essentially, Canadian backers are going to save $8 over what you are currently set to pay!

First off, I apologize for the late update. I was out of town and away from my computer all weekend. However, good news - we reached the $10000 mark which unlocks a lair pack stretch goal!
Lair Pack
One of three lair packs will be unlocked, based on a popular vote. The choices are The Alchemist's Workshop, The Forgotten Crypt, or The Wizard's Tower. The lair pack will contain 10 items that would be appropriate in that lair. The Alchemist's Workshop, for example, may contain powerful elixirs and other consumables, while The Forgotten Crypt may contain a lich's staff or the divine hammer of a long-dead adventurer.

Things are chugging along on the kickstarter front. I have a few quick updates.
New Add-Ons
As I mentioned in the last update, we hit the stretch goal to unlock blank cards and signature weapons (woohoo!). The completionist pack will contain all of the signature weapons and 5 blank cards, but they are also purchasable as add-ons for those only buying loot decks or for those who want extra blank cards.

Today was incredible. We blasted past 2 new stretch goals, and we are almost at $7000 for a 3rd. Thank you to all the new backers; I am so excited to be able to add these signature weapon packs!
Signature Weapon Packs
Today we unlocked signature weapons for either The Warriors (Barbarian, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue) or  (Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard). The plan was for everyone to vote on it...but we kind of powered right through the next stretch goal and are now knocking on the door of the $7000 goal - which will unlock the other one! So, I will start work on selecting and creating signature weapons for all of the classes. I will most likely do an average of one classic weapon from the SRD and one homebrew weapon for each class. I'll post some updates as I work on those. I think these will be a lot of fun and I can't wait to get my hands on them.

project_data.project_name: Loot Cards for 5E

campaign.story:
Table Titans began three years ago as an online comic created by Scott Kurtz to celebrate his love of Dungeons & Dragons. Quickly growing from one creator posting twice a week to three creators posting daily, Table Titans has become one of the web's biggest gaming comics. Illustrated by Scott Kurtz, Brian Hurtt, Steve Hamaker and a host of the comic industry's best known creators, Table Titans chronicles the adventures of Val Bronzebottom and her friends Darius, Alan, Andrew, Darby, and their DM Brendan as they embark on adventures at and away from the gaming table. 
WHAT IF I MISSED OUT ON VOL 1 OF TABLE TITANS?
No problem! Our first Kickstarter was a huge success and we've picked up a lot of new fans since then, so with this Kickstarter we're offering both Table Titans Volume 1: First Encounters and Table Titans Volume 2: Winter of the Iron Dwarf as beautifully oversized KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE hardcover books!
Though our reward tiers with Table Titans Volume 1: First Encounters are VERY LIMITED there's no need to worry; we will always keep the whole comic series FREE TO READ ONLINE AT TABLETITANS.COM!
  WHAT IF I'VE NEVER PLAYED D&D?
No problem! If you like high adventure, swords and sorcery, action, drama, comics, laughing and a whole lot of fun, then Table Titans is for you. It DOESN'T MATTER if you've played D&D. No... seriously, it doesn't matter, but don't be surprised if this comic makes you want to try it out. Whether you're a hardened RPG vet, a casual reader with a slight interest in D&D, or if you just love comics, Table Titans, like any roleplaying game, is about telling good stories.
BUT I'M NOT IN THE UNITED STATES AND SHIPPING & CUSTOMS FEES ARE OUTRAGEOUS!
Fortunately for you, we've arranged for rewards to ship from various locations around the globe and we're covering the costs of any additional customs fees. Look for the ★ INTL SHIP version of your reward tier for the best rates!
SOUNDS GOOD, NOW TELL ME MORE ABOUT THE LOOT!
Ah yes, the sweet lootz. Well, first and foremost there are the books. These are oversized, full-color, hardcover tomes featuring KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE cover treatments. You can only get the Kickstarter editions by being a Backer!
WHAT IF I WANT A LITTLE MORE WITH MY BOOK?
You're in luck. Thanks to our fantastic Backers unlocking Stretch Goals galore you can get some fancy Print Sets, Sticker Sheets, and a Moleskine-Style Table Titans Adventure Journal perfect for all your gaming needs!
YEAH, YEAH, BOOKS ARE GREAT. WHAT ELSE YOU GOT?
Oh, you're in it for the good stuff, huh? SO BE IT! How about Kickstarter Exclusive Print Sets, Sticker Sheets, as well as polyhedral of a variety of shapes and sizes, dreaded Mimics disguised as chest-shaped dice bags to protect your plastic gaming bits, and Pinny Arcade Collectors Pins declaring your allegiance to the Table of Titans!
MORE, GIVE ME MORE!
Why you greedy little... alright, you've asked for it. We've teamed with the Gnomish tinkerers at Elderwood Academy to bring you a Table Titans Scroll & Codex for your ultimate die-rolling needs!
YASS! THAT'S IT, I'M READY FOR ADVENTURE!
Then have a look at the Reward Table below. Together we're going to make an amazing book and some fantastic pieces of art. Chose your Rewards wisely and remember, "Titans never say die!"
GIVE ME ADD-ONS, GIVE ME CHOICE! YOUR LOOT COMBOS DO NOT PLEASE ME!
Alright, alright, it's fair to say that you probably know what you want better than we do. Which is why any items from this Kickstarter, as well as some items from our last Kickstarter, are also available a la carte (that's French)!
Simply pick the reward tier you'd like, then add the amount listed in the chart below for any items you'd like to "add-on" to your pledge. Once the campaign is over, we'll use powerful BackerKit Wyzards and their magical Surveys to ask you which add-on items you wanted, and voila (more French) you'll get exactly the combination of rewards you desire!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks when publishing books and manufacturing products. Trust us, after almost nine months of delays in our last Kickstarter we've now got experience with most of them. Everything from paper and fabric shortages to coastal pirates... yes, pirates.

But we've got no fear this time around (except from pirates) because for this Kickstarter we've already finished all the book prep, locked down our printers, and are ready to send our prototypes to their manufacturers.

We've also teamed with one of the biggest and best crowdfunding companies in the industry: BackerKit.

Through BackerKit we'll easily be able to manage add-ons, surveys, address changes, and fulfillment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We had some folks saying they wanted to make last minute changes to their BackerKit accounts, to the last day to make final updates to your order is tomorrow, Sunday, August 12th!
After this date, we will lock your reward selections and charge cards for add-on item purchases, pledge upgrades, and pre-orders. You can update your shipping address up until we lock addresses for shipping.
If you haven’t answered your survey yet, if you fill out your BackerKit survey, or pay for extra shipping after the  order due date, we’ll still receive your information but your shipment may be delayed.

updates.update_content: This spring Kickstarter passed a momentous milestone: over $1 billion pledged to repeat creators. To mark the occasion, they’ve invited some of their most beloved creators back to the platform for a celebration of creativity called Kickstarter Gold.

While we wait for all the goodies to get back from the printer, we’ve been thinking a lot about the Table Titans Game Tokens. We talked in one of our last Updates about how the Game Tokens were the only Stretch Goal we’d ever missed, how 37 fearless Backers chose them as add-ons via BackerKit (stay tuned early adopters, we’ve got you covered) and how we had a plan…
Backer, Friends, Adventures, Game Token lovers, have we got news for you!

campaign.story:
Missed the project? Back through Paypal here.
Maybe it was some sort of bureaucratic oversight on the part of the divine penitentiary system? Maybe the waning health and advanced age of the Giant's High King caused his children to begin their machinations to seize his power? Perhaps they were awakened by the coming of an even greater threat? Whatever the reason, the Giants have returned! 
Ever since we made our second Troll back in 2013 I've wanted to do a project that is all huge-sized characters. I've daydreamed for years about the kinds of shenanigans that a party of trolls, giants, and ents would get up to: What would their motivations be? Who would dare take on a balanced party of huge-class creatures? What kind of force for good (or evil) could they become?
This project is our chance to find out! We're going to make a bunch of giants and stuff so we (...and um you too I guess) can create a ton of awesome epic encounters and adventures!
In addition to making new huge-sized creatures, we'll also be offering our previously made huge-sized miniatures. You'll be able to get all of these oldies through this project (or on our website during this campaign while supplies last) for their original kickstarter prices! You'll also be able to get a 20% discount on everything else in our store during this kickstarter campaign by entering the coupon code GIANTKICK during the campaign!
We've already created 7 Huge Adventurers through our previous projects, and we are planning to make even more through this project, some of which Mike has already begun sculpting!
    They are, for the most part, trolls, full of personality and charm, but not all huge creatures are so friendly. The ancient race of giants is one of majesty and might. For centuries beyond counting, they have ruled the mountaintops, aloof and apart from the petty races that squabble below. The more majestic of these giants are proportionally closer to humans, but are still much bigger than your average 28mm figure! They will be the same 65mm to the eyes that the trolls have been.
  The huge-sized miniatures above will all be produced by this Kickstarter if we meet the base goal, cast in urethane resin, and will be available as choices for any of the reward levels that include giants.
      Unlocked companion miniatures will automatically accompany one of the huge miniatures.
Extra bases can be added for $2.00 each.
    Companion miniatures unlocked will automatically accompany one of the huge miniatures.
When we hit $29,000, the Modron Paladin will automatically accompany the Troll Mechanist. This morning, I didn't even know what a modron was! It turns out, they are pretty awesome!
  When we hit $33,000, the Enting Sprout will automatically accompany the Treant Shaman. Who said there were no more entings! (It was Treebeard, he was wrong!)
  We hit $35,000! The Sporeling will automatically accompany the Giant Barbarian. Once he's put the guards to sleep, he and the Barbarian will creep out into the underdark, his bio-luminescent head lighting their perilous way.
  When we hit $37,000, the Rust Beast will automatically accompany the Dire Owl. Dark Sun players, you guys are probably safe. Everyone else: just throw a wizard at it!
  We hit $38,500! The Kobold Bard will automatically accompany (No pun intended!) the Storm Giant. 
    It's difficult to chase those sheep down by yourself! Take this Labrador Retriever! We hit $40,000 so the Labrador will automatically accompany the Hill Giant Rustler on all raids. 
  When we hit $45,000 (Either during the funding period or afterward through Paypal donations) the Giant Children will be added to the Completionist Rewards. When that happens, they will also be available as a $15 add-on for the group of 3. They will be cast in pewter and the biggest of them will be about the size of our Half-Orcs. 
Thanks!
The Stonehaven Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we are fairly familiar with the process of sculpting and casting miniatures by now, there is still some small risk that our project will be significantly delayed by factors beyond our control. To mitigate this, we will be working with manufacturers that are here in the United States that we have worked with in the past. 

We will do everything we can to make sure that the miniatures are to our bakers by the date indicated on the reward, but out highest priority in relation to the project is ensuring that the miniatures are of the highest possible quality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to the campaign to create the PolyHero Wizard Set!   
Last year we ran a Kickstarter to produce a set of imaginative dice, the Warrior Set, and thanks to 2000+ supporters they are now a reality! Now it's time to get together and summon a series of special dice for spell-casters! The Wizard Set is once again the classic 7-piece set of RPG dice (plus special Kickstarter bonuses - see below), and this time we are also going for fancy and fittingly magical looking materials. 
You will be able to choose your colors and Level Up Packs pledged for after the campaign with a pledge manager we will send you. Check out the FAQ at the bottom of this page for more information.   
         PLAY

         Dice Specifications
   
3D prototypes
PLAY

Note: the 3D printing process leaves small artefacts on the models (visible in the video) that won't be present in the final production. 
PolyHero Dice are modelled and tested using 3D modelling software, then 3D printed for further testing. We don't claim the dice are as balanced as casino machined dice, but we design them using principles such as centre-of-mass and lines of symmetry, to make sure the dice are fully functional and randomized for general use. 
From Warrior to Wizard... what's new and why? 
We are reducing the price per set, and once again offering growing discounts when backing for multiple sets. The Wizard Set won't be packed in a multi-purpose hard case like the Warrior Set (for Kickstarter or at retail). As cool as it is, the case adds a cost to producing the product that understandably many people might not see the value in. So the Wizard Set (and eventually the Warrior Set) will now be packed in a bag or clam shell. 
We are using fancier, more expensive materials and ink for the dice, including pearlized, and transparent materials. 
We are charging $4 shipping worldwide (proportionately decreasing as you back for more sets). We've decided it is a lot easier for us to manage our budget with the shipping costs upfront and scaling to the number of sets backed for.
We will deliver the dice to backers at least a month prior to retail or convention release. This was always the intent with the Warrior Set, but there were extenuating circumstances that meant the dice were available at GenCon while they were still on the way to some backers. Game Salute kindly air freighted the dice from the factory (for their booth at GenCon, and also for the Kickstarter backers). As a result Kickstarter backers got their dice two months earlier than if we'd had to sea freight them, but it meant that there was a small amount of overlap in where they were available first. The plan moving forward with this and future campaigns is that backers will always get their dice well before retail or convention goers.
We are adding a matching 2-sided spell book to every Wizard Set purchased as part of the Kickstarter (the spell books won't be in the retail version of the dice)! 
Stretch Goals 
WE added...
We added the Spell Book as an "instant stretch goal". As soon as we hit the base funding goal it was added to every Wizard Set purchased (in a color matching the Wizard Set). The spell book is a special limited die that won't be available in the retail edition, but may down the track be available at conventions or as a promotion in limited quantities.
We unlocked 10 unique colors, including two Adventure Colors. 
We're retooling and creating more moulds so we can offer of specific dice, such as d6 or d20. See Wizard Level Up Packs.
We have added the option to pledge for a special Wizard's Hat d20 at a discount price. 
We unlocked a bonus Electrum and Alabaster spell book die to every Wizard Set and one for any Level Up Reward level pledge of $15 or higher (not including shipping).
Quest Goals
The success of this campaign, your enthusiasm and your ideas, have us looking to future sets with a clearer purpose and confidence, and wanting to invest the momentum and funds raised in this campaign towards that vision and those future sets. A goal being to be able to work on more ideas and designs, and take a lot less time to produce and deliver them to you. 
We think if we can design the dice with your feedback, make all the moulds, and get deep into the production sampling, all ahead of a campaign, then we could radically increase our capacity and turnaround for delivery, and go from 1 set a year, up to 2 or 3. It would also make for better campaigns as we would have all the moulds at the start and make Level Up Packs available immediately, then focus on different kinds of stretch goals. We'd essentially be able to start from deeper into the campaign and then build from there. 
So we’ve scoped out two "Think Big" stretch goals. Even if we don't hit these grand goals, the campaign has been a huge boost to the future of PolyHero Dice, and extra funds from the Wizard campaign will still be invested into future sets, but these "PolyHero Quest Goals" mark the levels of funding where we can officially and publicly set the listed expectations for the next set/s.
PolyHero Dice Games
Last campaign we created Knight Fight, a game to play with the Warrior Set (available from PolyHero.com). Once again we have our ideas to get the Wizards in the mix, though we aren't at the same stage we were with Knight Fight. We are now developing a game that we think could be pretty awesome, but it won't be ready for a little while!
-

The Warrior Set
During the Wizard Set campaign the Warrior Set (in the deluxe hard case) will be available from PolyHero.com. You of course won't need to wait for the Warrior Set as it is already made! Knight Fight is also available. If you want the Warrior Set sent to you with the Wizard Set, then see the FAQ below.
        Credits
PolyHero Dice are the result of a creative collaboration between brothers Dann and Greg May. We've worked together in the visual arts for more than 20 years, as graphic designers, artists and 3D animators. We've also played Dungeons and Dragons (and other RPGs) together from an early age, starting with the red boxed Basic Set. This project is a labour of love for us; to create imaginative, 3D-sculpted custom dice for a favourite hobby, and for the pure joy of holding and rolling them.
Dann May is a visual artist, animator and graphic designer. Since 2015 has been the resident art/creative director and artist at tabletop game publisher Game Salute, where he has worked on numerous board and card games including Nothing Personal, King's Forge, Legends of the American Frontier and Planetarium.
Greg May is a professional 3D Animator and Modeller with over 20 years in the industry working on projects including children's television programs, medical animation and live event installations. He also freelances creating high end rendered images of board games, and created the art for the upcoming board game Planetarium.
For more information visit polyhero.com

Dice Maniacs' Club
We're members of the Dice Maniac's Club! If you love dice, weird dice, cool dice, interesting, surprising, beautiful dice, and you'd like to share your hobby with a welcoming and respectful community, then be sure to join us.
  Thanks to Kevin, Michael, and all the Dice Maniacs for their support, guidance and encouragement over the journey. It means a lot!
Shipping
For more information on customs friendly shipping, click here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We learned a lot about making custom dice through our experience making the Warrior Set, which was successfully delivered thanks to a lot of work and support.

We know that it will take time to get any custom dice, with as much going on as PolyHero Dice, created. That's why we've completed all the 3D modelling up front and allowed until May 2017 to complete production and deliver the dice. Our goal is to deliver them as soon as possible, and ultimately we would like to be able to produce a new set every 6 months, but until we have proven that is possible, we won't presume to set a tighter target date.

We are also once again keeping this campaign very simple, with one set of designs in a growing variety of colors and ways to package them.

We'll as always provide you with updates at each major milestone of production and delivery. We appreciate your comments and feedback. We'll provide any changes inspired by your feedback in our updates. If you've got a question or comment, whether it's in person, via email, or on this project page, we appreciate it.

Sometimes, after a campaign successfully funds, life happens and a few people will want to cancel their pledge before the estimated delivery date. If that happens, just contact us and we'll be happy to make arrangements to process a full refund for you. 

Thanks for supporting us in making our idea for these dice a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New PolyHero Campaign Brings New Rogues, Clerics, Warriors, and Wizards
updates.update_content:
Greetings Wizards,

We are very excited to announce that the new PolyHero Cleric Set is LIVE ON KICKSTARTER! That’s not all: This Kickstarter Includes the remastered Warrior Reforged Set & the return of our popular Wizard and Rogue sets! Now each with 2 D20s!

Greetings backers!
We wanted to let you know that the Rogue Set is now live on Kickstarter! I've already seen a lot of familiar faces among the backers so far, so thank you to everyone who has decided to join us for the new campaign!

Greetings backers!
Tomorrow we are heading down to San Antonio, TX for PAX South! If any of you will be in attendance, we hope you'll come by our booth, #10065. It was great meeting so many of you at PAX Unplugged, and we hope to meet more of you!
One half of the design team behind the dice, Dann May, has flown in from Australia for the occasion, so this would also be a cool opportunity to meet Dann and pick his brain about the dice!

updates.update_userinfo: Rogue Set is Now Live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Greetings backers,
I'm thrilled to announce that we completed fulfillment today. Thank you all for your patience as we worked to get all the orders shipped out! It was a huge task, and I'd like to give a special shoutout to the awesome staff at Ship Naked who have been working overtime and weekends (not to mention braving blizzards!) for us for the last few weeks.

Greetings backers,
Just wanted to give you all an update of where we are in the shipping process. Things are continuing along at a steady rate, and Ship Naked has been working really hard to accommodate the volume of this project — they've approved overtime, added extra shifts including Saturdays, and have hired some additional personnel just for this project. So rest assured, they are working extremely hard to get everything shipped as fast as they can!

We're so excited to officially announce that the next PolyHero set, Rogue, will be coming to Kickstarter January 23rd! Thanks to everyone who voted for what they wanted the next set to be! The Brothers May have been sneakily cooking up some truly spectacular dice — here's a sneak peek!

Greetings, backers!
Many of you are starting to receive your dice, which is fantastic! We've loved seeing photos of everyone's sets. If you'd like to share a photo of your set, you can send it to us on Facebook or Twitter.
I'm noticing some questions cropping up in the comments that I thought I'd answer here, since it can be difficult to track comments on Kickstarter.

campaign.story:
Your barbarian got poisoned? Your cleric was blinded?  Give players the corresponding condition card to use as a reference. Return the card when the condition is removed. These gorgeous full-color reference cards complement and enrich your 5E RPG experience. As a GM quickly and easily track fifth edition conditions for your own role-playing and tabletop adventure!
The deck of Condition Cards contains the standard 5E conditions (Appendix A: Conditions, page 105). All of the artwork is complete and card layout for both front and back is finished. We are ready to bring Condition Cards to your table!
This 52 card deck contains thirteen unique conditions for up to four players. Each deck has four copies of each condition to cover your party.
Contains four of each:
Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Grappled, Incapacitated, Invisible, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Restrained, Stunned, Unconscious
  Combat Cards are geared for tracking rules when engaged in combat and will also be unlocked along with the Condition Cards upon successful funding at $5k.  It will start with:
Dying: Add four Dying cards to the deck of Combat Cards to be used to track players' last minutes.
Exhaustion: Add four Exhaustion cards to the deck of Combat Cards to track the progression of the inevitable.
Hidden: Add four Hidden cards to the deck of Combat Cards for your sneaky heroes.
Prone: Add four Prone cards to the deck of Combat Cards to bring your players to the ground!
Initiative Cards: A set of six ordered Initiative cards. Use Initiative cards to keep track of combat order during gameplay.
As part of our Kickstarter campaign stretch goals, we would really like to add additional cards to the Combat Cards deck.
There are two ways to unlock cards:
Every $200 over the $5k Goal will unlock an additional Combat Card
Every 100 likes on our Facebook page will unlock an additional Combat Card
Invite friends on Facebook to like our page:
https://www.facebook.com/critgames
Cards will be added to the deck of Combat Cards according to the following Stretch Goals:
*UNLOCKED* Incorporeal: Add four Incorporeal cards to the deck of Combat Cards to move through barriers.
*UNLOCKED* Death Save: Add six Death Save cards to the deck of Combat Cards to be used to track success or failures when making death saves.
*UNLOCKED* Cover: Add four Cover cards to the deck of Combat Cards for full, half, and three-quarters cover rules.
*UNLOCKED* Mounted: Add four Mounted cards to the deck of Combat Cards to provide rules for mounted combat.
*UNLOCKED* Underwater: Add four Underwater cards to the deck of Combat Cards to fight monsters underwater.
*UNLOCKED* Concentration: Add four Concentration cards to the deck of Combat Cards to track when a spell caster is concentrating.
*UNLOCKED* Flanking: Add four Flanking cards to the deck of Combat Cards to add the optional rule for flanking in 5e.
$8k *UNLOCKED* Premium Materials: cards to be made with improved materials.  Manufacturing selections will be made with high-quality paper to provide a better overall game experience.
Additional decks either Condition or Combat may be added:
Add additional decks for $12
For bulk (12+ decks), add additional decks for $7.50
How many times has your adventuring party turned into a party after a visit to the local tavern? Introducing a bonus condition, Intoxicated!
When a friend pledges, receive four copies of a special bonus card with your Condition Deck:
After a friend pledges, redeem your bonus card here.
If two friends have both pledged for a Condition Deck, each may redeem their own Intoxicated card per Condition Deck. If multiple Condition Decks are being ordered together in order to split among friends, just have someone pledge at the $1 tier and redeem as normal.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have fully produced quality tabletop accessories for our own table and would love to bring them to yours!

We have worked with artists and production, but as always timings and delays can arise. We'll do our best and will try to make things right. If a deck ultimately can't be delivered for some reason, we will be happy to refund pledges.

We are a small, indie game developer and we've poured a good amount of love into this product to bring a great game experience. If you are interested to see more of these types of tabletop products please consider sharing it with friends!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
DnD 5e Condition Cards and Combat Cards
Packages have been steadily going out and we will be sending out the remainder of the kickstarter pledges as well as pre-orders.  It's time to bring these to life on your table and into your games!
Production shipment has arrived!

Quick-Update
The production shipment made its way to Seattle, however, we are awaiting reception in Portland. We've had a bad winter storm here in Portland--in fact, one of the snowiest days on record. Suffice to say roads are impassible due to inclement weather. We are actively working with the delivery company but do not yet have a confirmed delivery day. Stay tuned!
Give-Away

Bonus Cards Arrival
Many a good adventure has started in the local tavern and many a good tavern has a local brewery. Production Intoxicated Bonus Cards have arrived! A set of four cards will be lovingly paired with every kickstarter order and sent out when the rest of the decks arrive.  We are on track for receiving Condition Card Decks and Combat Decks for the second week of January.

Arrival Date
We now have an arrival date!  Working with our manufacturers, we have been informed that mass-production quantities will be arriving the second week in January.  We will immediately begin shipping them out that week! Unfortunately this is later than our original estimates to ship before the end of the year.  Please be assured, we are working to get these decks onto your gaming tables as soon as we can.
Production Samples

Mass Production
We are pleased to announce that mass production is underway!  We've given the green light to pre-production samples and made all of the final adjustments to improve overall production quality.  We are looking forward to receiving these mid-December.

We've received our first set of pre-production cards!  These cards are prototypes for the final decks and are used to check print and layout quality.
Condition Cards Full Layout
All of the artwork for the Combat Deck is now complete!  Finally with Concentration, Cover, and Death Save, we now have the full set of images needed for the Combat Deck!

Combat Cards
We've been busy creating artwork for the Combat Deck and we are excited to show you some of the fantastic results!  We still have some more to complete, but here is mounted, underwater, flanking, and incorporeal:

campaign.story:
All six sword together
Tiny Blades - Miniature Silver Swords
We believe that true design could only be born as a fusion of aesthetics and functionality. Sword is excellent example: many generations of blacksmiths polished it's form so it would be Awesome. In all meanings.
Rapier
Swords are inalienable part of our culture. From a weapon it became an object of Art. May be because of that young blacksmiths choose to study sword forging.
Saber
 Sword is now a symbol. Symbol of Knighthood, Honor and Dignity. Many Gods and Goddess have a sword as their insignia - like Mars or Themis.
Flame-bladed sword as a pendant
So, if swords are not weapons any more, but still attract so much attention - wouldn't it be natural to bring such a pretty thing into more common object? A part of collection, or, for example - a keychain, pendant or broach - 4 inches (10 cm) long?
Katana broach
Or you can entertain your guests with these dazzling accessories on their plate. Make martini even more special with a blue cheese staffed olive spanned with tiny Katana sword.
Straight sword
Rewards
There are 6 kinds of swords:
Katana
Straight sword
Saber
Flyssa
Flame-bladed sword
Rapier
As rewards we would like to offer you any number of swords you want to have and if you want a set of six - there is a special category for you.
And it's totally up to you to customize your swords set. May be you only wanted 6 Katanas?
And for those picky ones of you - there are swords made of Platinum or Gold.
How we made it
It's always easier to say, than to bring it to life. At the beginning we decided to start with hand-crafted prototypes. Handles of swords were carefully made of wax and then casted into Silver.
Flyssa hilt made of wax
On the opposite, blades were made with hammering and polished afterwards.
(Click "CC" for subs!)
This methods combination on one hand let us focus on the design and on the other hand not consume too much time as it doesn't require 3D printing. Afterwards, both parts were soldered into one beautiful sword.
Flyssa - complete and polished
Now with prototypes tested we can start classic process 3D modelling - 3D printing - Casting
Why KickStarter?
When you decide to become an independent creator of cool thing, in the beginning you are totally dependent: from someone who will 3D print your model for you, from casting service who will create first prototype in a metal. And this is not a question of money - it's all about freedom. Without your own precision 3D printer and casting facility you very are limited in number of ideas, that could be created.
And we need that freedom to be able to bring all our ideas to life, to create more Tiny Blade - brooches, tie clips and many more. So if you decided to become a backer - it's not only about receive something amazing and cool (yes, hope that everyone will think something like that about our Tiny Blades), but also that you were someone who made our existence and future possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The major challenge for Kickstarter project is to deliver everything in time. And some of our reward are got ambition to be delivered before Christmas. As a most time-consuming part is casting - we built relationships with foundry to fulfill orders.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Missed the Project? You can back through Paypal until a month before we ship! Just click the link below!
BACK THROUGH PAYPAL 
Halflings are a hearty folk. Consuming seven or more meals each day keeps them in fine form for questing and merrymaking. Although they deeply love savory vittles and pleasant company, they are surprisingly agile and deadly when pressed. 
The Halfling Adventurers Miniatures Project is about creating miniatures to represent a set of Halfling heroes and their various pets, companions, and foods. Choose from any of our amazing Adventuring Parties. The goal here is simple: get the miniatures sculpted, cast, and distributed to all of you! We have a variety of stretch goals planned that will enhance and diversify your Halfling Adventurers. 
The Halflings will represent a relatively balanced adventuring party and/or a selection of Halfling heroes to lead any fantasy army.  
The Halflings will be sculpted by sculptor Mike Evans on a 28 millimeter heroic scale and cast in lead-free white pewter metal; fitting well with almost all tabletop wargaming and RPG miniatures.
Included in the project will be printable character cards that can be used with our upcoming game: Stonehaven Peacekeeper's Oath (Currently in Beta Testing) Feel free to download and print the RULES and some starter CARDS and TERRAIN and try it out!
So that you can anticipate the level of quality and the style of the miniatures that you will receive, here are some of the dwarves that were made possible through our Dwarven Adventurers KS! 
 Dwarves were sculpted by Mike Evans. Dwarves were painted by James Wappel (who also made the scenic bases and took the photographs)
We want to make as many halflings and halfling-related stuff as we can stand. We have stretch goals planned that will add either a Halfling miniature, a Halfling-related item (Second breakfast!), a companion, or a terrain .PDF to the Adventuring parties for every additional $2000 in funding that is pledged!
 Some goals will add to existing backer levels, others will require backers to increase their pledges to access the fruits of meeting the goals. Mike wanted to give the minis away for free but the rest of us need to eat.
When we hit $54,000, The Mounted Commander will be added to the Dust Runners Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. He's ready to lead his troops from atop his fluffy steed!
When we hit $56,000, The Berserker will be added to the Dust Runners Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. Even an orc will flee from a berserker when the rage sets in.
When we hit $58,000, The Lamb will be added to the Citizens of Ramsglen Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. The lamb is a fierce battle companion and...um...who are we kidding? It's a cosmetic pet at best, but it will be super cute!
When we hit $60,000, The Unconscious Halfling will be added to the Citizens of Ramsglen Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. Is he wounded? Is he dead?!!! Or is he just tuckered out after a day spent fishing with his best friend?
When we hit $63,000, The Boar Mount will be added to the Dust Runners Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. The Boar is a vicious and ill-tempered beast. Few would seek to tame one; even fewer would dare to use one as a mount.
When we hit $65,000, The Swords and Shield Bits will be added to the Completionist Reward. This standard issue gear is probably not enchanted in any way.
When we hit $66,000, The Mounted Barbarian will be added to the Dust Runners Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. After fending off the dire bear together, the Berserker and the boar decided upon a tentative truce.
When we hit $68,000, The Gardener will be added to the Completionist Reward. Armed with frying pan and blade, she follows the ancient way of the gardener and remains steadfast (despite the numerous cursed heirlooms that her companions insist on carrying about).
When we hit $70,000, The Dark Lord will be added to the Completionist Reward. Enough halflings get stabbed with tainted blades and eventually one of them will turn. Its inevitable.
When we hit $72,000, The Maiden (seated/sidesaddle) will be added to the Completionist Reward. She's ready to ride a boar or sit on a bench in the Inn. Either one. 
When we hit $74,000, The Wool Merchant (standing) will be added to the Completionist Reward. He's well known in these parts and will give your halfling farmers a fair price for their wool and furs. 
When we hit $75,000, The Pitched Camp Pop-Up Terrain .PDF will be added to the Dust Runners Adventuring Party and the Completionist Reward. When we pitched our tents near the standing stone, we had no idea of its power. Prototype shown here. The final version will have color artwork.
When we hit $77,000, The Halfling Tiefling will be added to the Completionist Reward. What? You thought that only humans could be affected by their bargains with extra-planar beings?
When we hit $80,000, The Grippli Knight and "Mount" will be added to the Completionist Reward. You cannot doubt his courage, only the reach of his arm.
 $25 - Midwinter's Guardians Adventuring Party Includes:
$25 - Buttonwood Band Adventuring Party Includes:
$25 - Staff of Hambledon's Inn Adventuring Party Includes:
$25 - Black Watch Alliance Adventuring Party Includes: 
$25 - Burnville Troops Adventuring Party Includes:
$25 - Citizens of Ramsglen Adventuring Party Includes:
$25 - Dust Runners Adventuring Party Currently Includes:
All mounts and riders will be interchangeable.
"Locked" Miniatures will be unlocked and added as we reach stretch goals!
By increasing your pledge amounts by the cost for each add-on you can add these miniatures to your reward. 
$16 - Treant - This massive Old Growth Treant has been awakened...and he's not a morning person! Model will measure 65mm to the eyes and will be cast in high-detail resin. This miniature is automatically included in the Completionist Reward.
$30 - PRINTED Color Pop-Up Terrain (4 pictured here + 4 more!) ~ This is NOT included at the Completionist Level. International Shipping is $22.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk in this project is that (due to circumstances out of our control) the miniatures will be delivered later than we planned.

That being said, we've done this before and with shorter deadlines. We've ironed out the kinks in the process and we've been open and honest about what we are doing every step of the way.

While we do have to send portions of the project out (for casting, writing, etc.) to be completed, these are companies/individuals that we have established relationships with and are familiar with their time-tables and craftsmanship.

We're confident and excited about producing these halflings and getting them out into your hands!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 2 Days Left in Giants Kickstarter! We've Added More Giants!
updates.update_content: The Giants Kickstarter is ramping up to it's climactic conclusion!
We've just launched the Stonehaven's Giants Kickstarter! In this project we plan to make some awesome giants and other Huge-Class Creatures! Some of the concept art for them:

We've shipped out all of the orders!
 (Except for a few that we were waiting on responses from. We'll ship those out as we get the info!)
We're still working on the character cards. Those will be made available as we get them put together.

Some add-ons were far more popular than we anticipated. We realized over the weekend that there were several miniatures that we need to restock on before we are able to conclude shipping. The pewter miniatures shouldn't cause much delay (they are usually here within a week or so) but the Treant was also a more popular add-on than we foresaw and the mold-making and casting process for resin is more lengthy and may cause up to another month delay.

Just wanted to give you guys the heads up that we are about half-way done shipping. We'll have the rest out within a week or so. As always, packing up tens of thousands of miniatures and bases takes longer than I expected!
As we pack we've been discussing our next project. We've got a couple of ideas including: 65mm Adventurers (trolls and troll-sized Figures as a group), Themed Adventuring Parties including multiple fantasy races (Far East, Egyptian, Viking, Steampunk, Tribal), Or  Dwarves Vol. 2 (We need to make some more dwarves! I love sculpting them!)

updates.update_userinfo: Update on Shipping: We're Looking Good!
updates.update_content:
We're assembling the completionist sets now! While we do have one more shipment on the way from our casters, we are on schedule to have things ready to send out by next week.
One more shout out to our friends at Iron Wind Metals who are running an awesome kickstarter with some really great sculpts from their Ral Partha line as well as some cool paper terrain from Fat Dragon Games. Their Kickstarter has just a few hours left so check it out!

campaign.story:
8/4/2015: The Hoodie design!
The number one question we've been getting is whether or not we've posted the hoodie design yet, and I've been reluctant to commit to doing so until I knew the design was truly ready. And I can tell you right now - it's beautiful.
BEHOLD!
The chest portion will be embroidered, and the clocktalk on the sleeve and lower back will be screen printed, black-on-black.
Close up of embroidery
So a couple of things to note:
1. Everyone has been asking me what hoodie "type" this will be made of, and I was told it would be the same as the Thanks Obama hoodie we sell on the store. Well, the designers decided to upgrade it to a more expensive type, but unfortunately we lose the thumbholes. So if you were dead set on the thumbholes, we understand if you have to change your pledge BUT...
2. ... The upgrades to this hoodie are now have an athletic, water resistant, tight weave to it (water beads on it, rather than soaks it up). Although it is obviously a very cool and useful feature, the reason for it was more aesthetic - the sheen to the material was decided to be more thematically appropriate for Automata, and it really made the black-on-black design pop. For sizes 4x and above, it'll be the same design but with a slightly different hoodie blank (same color).
3. If you have not purchased the hoodie yet, you still can via our add-on offer ($70 per hoodie for domestic, $75 for international). If you'd like to take advantage of the add-on offer, go to this page and click "Manage" on the right side. Add $70/75 per hoodie to that amount, and then when we send out the surveys, we'll ask you how many of the ADD-ON Hoodie you wanted. (Yes, you can add on as many hoodies and add-on pins as you'd like - we will sort it out at the survey process)
And as with all the stuff here, this hoodie will NEVER be made or sold again outside of this kickstarter campaign.
Thank you everyone! We've got 6 days to go!!
----
7/28/2015: 2 Weeks Left! ANOTHER PIN DESIGN!
Wait, what do you mean another pin design? You only have one pin available on this campaign, right?  
That was true... UNTIL NOW!  
We're offering a Second, Completely Different and Unique pin design for those pledging at the PIN DESIGN tier or higher as an optional ADD-ON. If you'd like this new design, add $25 per Add-On pin (regardless if you are shipping internationally or domestically).  
This pin is DUAL LAYER, so the broken Carl mask will sit on top of the base level. This pin will NEVER be made or sold again, so not only is it exclusive for the next two weeks, but the quantity made will be limited to that actually ordered for this Kickstarter Campaign. The quantity made will be stamped on the back of the pin.  
So if you'd like to take advantage of the add-on offer, go to this page and click on "Manage" on the right side. You can change the amount at the top without changing the reward. So, for instance, you are currently at the $150 tier, there's a little box with your pledge amount in it (it says "It's up to you. Any amount of $1 or more." to the right of it). Add $25 to that amount, and then when we send out the surveys, we'll ask you how many of the ADD-ON Pin you wanted.  
Also! If you added on the Hoodie already, you can stack that as well! No worries, we'll get it all sorted in the Post-Campaign Survey stage!  
Two weeks left and 10k to go! We should be able to close this out soon, and then it's stretchgoal territory! Thank you everyone!
----
7/22/2015: HOODIE ADD ON UPDATE!
We've been getting tons of emails and messages asking us to open up more hoodies... so the best way to do this without messing with the rarity of the pins is to offer it to you as an add-on at ANY LEVEL. What this means is if you want a hoodie (or an additional hoodie), INCREASE your pledge level by $70 for U.S. addresses and by $75 for International addresses, and we'll make sure you get the exclusive hoodie. (do it again if you want additional) When it comes time to issue out our surveys, we'll ask you if you pledged for an additional hoodie and what size you asked for etc.
Click on "Manage" on the right side, you can change the amount at the top without changing the reward. So, for instance, you are currently at the $55 tier. There's a little box with $55 in it (it says "It's up to you. Any amount of $1 or more." to the right of it) - you can change it there.
----
Six years ago, we released this comic.
Page 1 to the original Automata series.
Since then, it's spawned two additional mini-series (Blood & Oil and Silverside), a dedicated base of fans, and even interest from Hollywood. The goal from the beginning - with any of our side projects - is to find someone who loved it enough and could dedicate the time necessary to fully flesh out the Automata universe. That happened pretty quick: before we knew it, we were in talks with a number of different movie studios. To us, it became not a matter of if, but when, we'd be able to buy a ticket and watch a very, very large Carl and Detective Regal brooding on a movie screen.
But after spending four years trying to do things the "Hollywood Way," we've learned one thing: It's really really hard to get a movie made. The negotiations, the moving parts, the politics… Even when we had a property optioned - another project called The New Kid - it's not really a guarantee that anything will ever happen. The words "Period Piece" and "Sci Fi" together in close proximity give that town the hives. We found ourselves right back where we started. 
But, maybe that isn't such a bad thing. 
We went back to the drawing board, and with the help of friend and filmmaker Van Alan, we laid out the most pragmatic plan for what it would take to make an Automata series ourselves. Locations visited, scripts written, test footage shot - after two years of work from Van and his team, it started to seem like something we might actually be able to pull off.
Making a live action mini-series is expensive, and maybe not a very good "investment" in the classic sense. An actual movie studio would have a "portfolio" of films where one or two hits covers the losses for the rest of their lineup. Well, THIS IS THE ONLY ONE WE HAVE. And it doesn't have to make money - it just has to pay for itself. Its only responsibilities are:
1. Get made, and  
2. Be cool 
 ... We'll handle the second one, if you can handle the first. Sound good? 
TELL ME MORE
Test Footage Wireframes
The series will tell an original Automata story over five webisodes, each episode roughly 10-12 minutes long. Van has been working closely with Tycho/Jerry Holkins (that's, um, me) on the script. I don't really want to spoil it in, like, the Kickstarter pitch, but...  
Read at your own intense risk for spoilification:
Sam & Carl are hired by a wealthy businessman to spy on his wife. When she winds up dead, and an automaton goes missing, Sam & Carl find themselves wound up in an intricate plot of sex, intrigue, and deception. It will be rad. The end.
Lighting for Test Footage
If the project funds successfully, Van and his crew are going to get started on this IMMEDIATELY. They will begin casting the key roles, building sets, working on the VFX, etc. They're raring to go.
They'll "shoot" (movie term) before the end of the year, and those that back via the digital download reward will get to view it in the Summer of 2016, 3 months ahead of the worldwide release.
Tell me about Van and his crew!
VAN ALAN : Van is a Seattle-based filmmaker originally from Houston, TX. He has directed numerous music videos for bands such as The Presidents of the United States of America, Better Than Ezra, and Copeland. He has written and directed four short films and has been selected as a participant in the Texas Filmmakers Showcase in 2009 and 2010. In 2010, Van moved to Seattle to work with Penny Arcade to produce and direct their reality web-series and became the go-to guy to capture PAX conventions and other video projects.
WILL LUMMUS : Will is an independent film producer originally from Nacogdoches, TX. In 2009, he moved to Seattle and became integrated into the Seattle Independent Film Community, working as a production and location assistant and eventually location coordinating and producing. His recent production credits include films such as Touchy Feely, Laggies, You Can’t Win, Captain Fantastic, and Ridley Scott’s The Man In The High Castle.
LACEY LEAVITT : Lacey is a Seattle-based producer. She has produced and co-produced many of the best Seattle indie films of the last five years including Colin Trevorrow's Safety Not Guaranteed (Aubrey Plaza, Mark Duplass, Jake Johnson), Lynn Shelton's Laggies (Keira Knightley, Sam Rockwell, Chloe Grace Moretz) Megan Griffiths' Lucky Them (Toni Collette, Thomas Haden Church, Johnny Depp), and Todd Rohal's The Catechism Cataclysm (Steve Little, Robert Longstreet). She's a Sundance Creative Producing Lab alum and also co-directed the roller derby documentary Blood on the Flat Track.
Compositing for Test Footage
That's a really... interesting... funding goal.
We think so, too. After running two decent sized Kickstarter projects, we now know more about the tiny details of running them. We've seen how expensive rewards get, we've backed projects that failed, and we wondered if there wasn't a clearer way to handle it.
If you're interested in the nuts and bolts, business guy Robert Khoo put together this summary.
You’ve probably noticed that the goal for this project is a weird number. $322,637.09 is an oddly specific figure, some might say. Well, let’s break down that number to make sure you, as a backer, know what your money is actually going toward. 
Let’s first start with this: $251,842.46. That’s the ACTUAL cost of producing the series. The breakdown of this budget, put together by Van, are as follows. 
Automata Webseries Production Budget
You may have heard that Van was able to secure funding from the State of Washington which reduced the budget by $46,000. So we can go ahead and deduct that amount right off the top from $251,842.46, which leaves us with $205,842.46 that we need to raise from backers via Kickstarter. 
But wait! $205,842.46 doesn’t match up with $322,637.09 we’re asking for. Where did that extra money go? Well, two things. 
1. Based on our previous Kickstarter projects, we now know our average Reward Cost Rate is 27.7%. That means for every dollar you kick in, it actually costs us (on average) 27.7 cents to produce and fulfill the reward you asked for. This includes design, production, warehouse labor, and even the box and tape that is necessary to ship the thing. 
2. The Kickstarter Fee is 5%. The average processing fee is 3.5%. 
Since we know it’ll cost us 27.7 cents for every dollar we raise AND we need to pay Kickstarter and CC companies their fees, we need to raise more than $205,842.46. In fact, after accounting for Rewards and Fees, you can see where we reach our actual goal of $322,637.09. 
This makes more sense if we do it in reverse: 
$322,637.09 is what we’re asking for. 
Kickstarter and credit card fees knock off 8.5%. That leaves us with $295,212.94 
To fulfill the rewards of $322,637.09, it’ll cost us 27.7% of that. That breaks down to $89,370.47. $295,212.94 less $89,370.47 is... <drum roll> $205,842.46. 
PLEDGE LEVELS!
Full level descriptions found on right side of page!
Stretch Goals!

Risks and challenges
I would say the biggest risk we will run into are with budget overruns and unforeseen delays in productions. We've been working with Van for the past four years now on PA: The Series and other projects, and he's one of the most skilled project managers we know. But again, there are still things that could come up that no one could possibly be aware of. You have both Penny Arcade and Van's promise that if this funds, this project is going to get done.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Help us Make More Bones™ Plastic Miniatures - more heroes, more monsters, in more sizes! 
FREE Video Game for iOS
Like the Video game inspired Maps? Want to play Bones 3 the Game?
For iOS devices, there is a Free Game! Check it out! 
                                                                            Or Click Here:
 https://ks.reapermini.com/bones3
  Why are we doing this?
Thanks to you, our last two Kickstarters were an amazing success! We’ve added over 500 new models to the Bones range, and we’ve discovered that these products are monstrously popular. You wanted more! More Monsters! More Demons! More Dragons! More Characters! More variety and more amazing new models!
You're in luck! We haven’t even scratched the surface. We have many more models that we think deserve to be added to Bones - new sculpts and classic favorites from our metal lines! We’d like to see if you think so, too!
Bones are still really expensive to produce, and we still need your help to expand the line. Your support makes the molds that we need to produce the figures, and in exchange you get the first crack at these figures for a fantastic deal!
What's in it for me?
We’ve learned a lot since we fulfilled our first two Bones Kickstarter projects, so you won’t find as many pledge levels. You won't find as many confusing options.  Turns out that most of you just wanted the core set with the potential to expand over time. What this Kickstarter will do is add 30 more models: character models, new sculpts, and monsters. After we hit our goal, we have plans to make the value of your pledge grow.
All we need is your support.
What Are Bones Gaming Miniatures?
Bones are only the best high-quality plastic gaming models to hit the industry in the last decade. Inexpensive, high quality, soft gaming models that are easy and fun to paint and won't break when you actually use them for games!
 Paizo has graciously given us their stamp of approval to release more of our officially licensed Pathfinder Miniatures into Bones! For more information on the Pathfinder RPG, head on over to Paizo.com and check out the best roleplaying system going right now!
Produced in Bones (with hard and soft Bonesium components) under license from Victoria Miniatures, we’re proud to be able to offer the M22bfg 'Sledgehammer' Heavy Howitzer, sculpted by Victoria Lamb and Jake Schneider!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories: 
1) Overall Non-completion 
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates 
3) We do not produce a specific model or change a specific model.

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed two massive Kickstarters and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of this Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment, no matter the size, against loss and damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We learned a lot during our two Kickstarters. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that would help us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays are easy to solve, such as replacing a printer that is creating barcodes that a particular USPS hub is having a problem reading. Other delays are out of our hands, such as the 2014-2015 longshoreman west coast work slow down that delayed all of our overseas containers. We have even intentionally created delays when we chose to change models already in production to make them better.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in a specific model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for to buy it verses the cost to produce it. This event did not occur in either of our previous Kickstarters, but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops we will issue a refund or credit depending on your desire for the buy in pledge amount of the model.

We reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.

In summary we have the knowledge, wisdom and know how to prevent, solve, and work through just about any problem that we will face and will do everything possible to make this an exciting and enjoyable event.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers! We launched our Bones 4 Kickstarter Campaign earlier this week and we wanted to make sure everyone had a chance to get in on it again!
https://youtu.be/gZ-yEQN9o7g

Aetherworks, our shipper out of Australia, has completed 40% of the shipments in 3 days. We expect them to be finished shipping in around a week. These shipments are not going out in Wave Order. These shipments do not appear on the shipping tracker.
RHQ Zombie Co has hired new staff and has worked through about 200 test shipments, and will be able to begin in earnest on Monday. There were unforeseen difficulties among the various test shipments, but all issues appear to be resolved now. Estimates range from 2-3 additional weeks, with a lot of that depending on the efficiency of the new personnel. These shipments are being processed in Wave Order, and will appear on the tracker, since Zombie Co uses our software and database to ship. Most parcels will be going out using DPD, but some may use Royal Mail or Parcelforce, depending on local requirements and regulations.

We have been told that the initial system tests on live orders were successful, about 100 orders have been successfully shipped to EuropeZone backers. Some of you may have already received postage notices and tracking information.
The plan for now is to make some changes to the puller's order of operations to increase efficiency, and begin shipping in full force and at top speed on Monday, July 3rd. It is expected to take less than 2 full weeks to ship all EuropeZone orders.

We have been informed by our partner in the UK that the container of rewards has arrived in port, and they are optimistic about arrival at their facility soon. They have told us that they expect to begin shipping rewards a day or two after delivery to them.
We do not have an update about AU rewards at this time, but we promise to inform you as soon as we have new information.

updates.update_userinfo: US Zone Shipping Complete! Questions, Help, Europe and Pacific Status!
updates.update_content:
Like the title says, we're done shipping US Zone rewards! (well, there's a few that had problems that needed resolving, but less than a dozen out of 10,000). Now that US Zone fulfillment is concluded, it’s important for us to address a few things.
First and foremost, THANK YOU from all of us at Reaper for your patience while we worked through the delays and tribulations of fulfillment. We know that it wasn’t always easy, and sometimes there was a great deal of frustration, but we made it! We truly could not have accomplished all of this without your support.

updates.update_userinfo: Slideshow - How we pull an order
updates.update_content:
No new news updates, but we thought it might be fun to show off how to pull an order. Bear in mind, we have taken all care to ensure confidential details are scrubbed, so there's lots of heavily edited pictures here.
First, our order pullers print a fresh "Tag". This has the backer address and a barcode, as well as a short summary of the backer's rewards (combining all possible orders by that backer). In the picture below, the backer had no paints, DVD, or sketchbooks, or you'd see a line that also said how much of each of the non-miniature rewards they got.

We've had a busy week, and not everything went as we originally  planned. We know that this caused some confusion, and it definitely caused delays, and while we were squaring it all away, we were not communicating. We chose to resolve the issues first, and explain later. This was not a choice many of you were happy with, and we apologize. We're on target now, and we're moving at a good clip, so we're taking minute to explain the new situation.
Europe Zone Orders

We're planning to begin fulfillment in earnest next week, so it is vital that everyone confirm that the address they are using in our Pledge manager (ks.reapermini.com/bones3) is valid and up to date.
Our Database doesn't play well with Non-Western-latin characters (Ü, Ø, Ñ, Ç, etc.) so if your address does feature those, please change it to the closest Western/Latin equivalent. We do have backers we emailed that have entered their addresses as an Asian characters that will need to be sure to change those as well.
No Zone Changes Allowed

campaign.story:
NEW REWARDS PACKAGES:
"SpockSwag" - Limited availability:
(sample artwork for illustrative purposes only -- final design may change slightly)
PHASERS from the new films created by Ken Palkow, one of the original props builders!
Authentic castings of the "Spock ears" from the original Motion Picture!
How It Started
Last year, just before Thanksgiving, I approached my dad, Leonard Nimoy, about the possibility of working together on a film about Mr. Spock. I had skimmed through some of the books on the making of Star Trek and felt there was so much more to explore about the birth and evolution of Spock. And the timing seemed right, as the 50th anniversary of Star Trek: The Original Series was not that far away. Dad agreed that now was the right time, and that he was 100% committed to collaborating with me on this project. He also reminded me that we were (then) just days away from the 50th anniversary of the start of production on “The Cage,” the original pilot for Star Trek in which Dad first appeared as Mr. Spock.
Please participate in my Kickstarter campaign and help me complete a project that was important to my dad and has become extremely important to me.

Thanks again for your time and consideration.

LLAP,
 Who Is Involved With This Project?
Earlier this year, my father and I reached out to 455 Films to help us produce this project. 455 Films is made up of producers David Zappone, Kevin Layne and Joseph Kornbrodt. Dad chose this company because he was familiar with the Star Trek related films they have produced with William Shatner and was impressed with their work. David, Kevin and Joseph are also very well versed in the Star Trek tradition, and have worked previously with all of the important players in the world of Star Trek. 
With their background in production and my experience in directing over 45 hours of network television, I'm very confident that we're going to deliver an entertaining and enlightening film about the lives of Leonard Nimoy and Mr. Spock.
In addition, I'm excited to announce that Zachary Quinto has generously agreed to narrate the film about the famous Vulcan, a character he now knows quite well himself.
 So, What's Next?
We're only just beginning our campaign on Kickstarter, but we're not coming to the table unprepared. In addition to having already completed a considerable amount of research on this film, I have personally compiled a treasure trove of pictures of the Nimoy family and of Dad in his many roles before and after Mr. Spock. And, of course, we have some great pix of Spock as well.
The funding of this film through Kickstarter will enable us to continue with production -- which will mostly take the form of filming interviews of Dad’s friends, colleagues and family members. It will also enable us to license the hundreds of film clips and still photographs of Mr. Spock as he has appeared on television and in feature films over the last fifty years. Funding will then buy us time in the editing room, where I will be poring over the film clips and photographs and never-before-seen home movies as well as Star Trek artifacts -- some of which have not seen the light of day for nearly fifty years! 
Once the edit is complete, we can then start working with a composer for a score which will play alongside the prerecorded music -- which we will also have to license. (Can you imagine referring to Dad’s recording career without hearing a few seconds of The Ballad of Bilbo Baggins? Unthinkable!) We also need funding for a sound editor and to pay for a final mix of all the elements.
What is this film really about?
This film was originally conceived as a tribute to Mr. Spock to help celebrate the 50th anniversary of the original series. Now, with Dad's passing on February 27th, the film will also explore the incredible career and artistry of Leonard Nimoy. But what has become increasingly apparent as I continue to work on this project is that it's also a personal journey. 
Although I had initially intended to take a somewhat detached, objective view of the subject matter, more and more people involved in this film have urged me to interject some of my own perspective on what it was like growing up with Mr. Spock in the house, and how Dad's new-found celebrity and meteoric career affected my life. 
How can I get more involved with the project? 
Spread the word via social media! While the fundraising is a critical part part of our focus right now, we also want to engage the community in any way possible. Follow us on Facebook or Twitter, share our story on your own blog or social media (tag us at @LoveOfSpock!), and keep an eye out throughout our campaign for other messages of how to get involved.
Check out content with our hashtag #SpockDoc and #SpockStories and share your own!
Reward Fulfillment… Or, When Do I Get My Stuff?
Please note, most digital rewards will be fulfilled through our website, www.ForTheLoveOfSpock.com in a special "Members Only" section. Assuming that our goal is fulfilled, we'll be reaching out to everyone shortly after the end of the campaign with details about claiming your rewards.
The digital screening will be hosted here as well, through the magic of VHX.tv. While we won't know the premiere date(s) until much closer, we're hoping to have the film ready to go in early-to-mid 2016. Once it's ready to be released, you'll receive information with a specially generated link. The link will be provided some time around the premiere, and will be available for a limited period of time. Not only will you be able to stream the film online, you will also be privy to a special, exclusive introduction and Q&A from the team.
** Please note that we intend to give you all an opportunity to see the film prior to the general public. Depending on our distribution requirements, there is a chance this may be following certain "premiere" festival screenings -- but rest assured we want to make sure you get to enjoy the film before the general public and celebrate our joint success! **
Though the film screening rewards won't be available until sometime in 2016, we'll fulfill all other gifts after the campaign has ended, as they become available. If you have any questions, check out the "Estimated Delivery" under each reward, or contact us directly at SpockDocumentary@gmail.com.
Our team is determined to resolve any problems or answer any questions in a timely manner, so please don't hesitate to contact us!
For more information, FOLLOW us (@LoveOfSpock) on:
Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
Check out some of the press!
Adam talks with ACCESS HOLLYWOOD LIVE! 6/24/15
George Pennacho of ABC7 interviews Adam Nimoy
Adam visited Fox's STUDIO 11 with some SPOCK memorabilia
Did you miss Adam's live AMA (Ask-Me-Anything) on Reddit?
See this, and other great questions in the AMA archive HERE
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No film project of this scale is without its own risks and challenges - but we're confident that we've assembled the right team to make this film professionally and within our deadline. And with the generous time and support of writers, directors and actors associated with STAR TREK (people like our narrator, Zachary Quinto) who have already agreed to appear on camera, I have no doubt that we will be able to tell the story that my dad and I intended.

We know our fundraising goal is ambitious. But we're confident that through YOUR support, we can accomplish it in the time allotted -- but now IT'S UP TO YOU! As stated above, our $600,000 goal will help us pay for the interview process and most of the elements we need to license for this film. After processing fees and mailing, we’ll actually only net somewhere around $530,000. Enough to do what we promised to do? Yes, but with very little wiggle room!

Rest assured: every dollar raised through this campaign will find its way to funding this film or helping in the promotion and advertising campaign. But the more we can raise, the better the end product will be. This film is a once-in-a-lifetime chance for us, and we want to give it all we have to give.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings FTLOS supporters!
I can’t believe it’s been nearly 6 months since the release of For The Love Of Spock!! We received an incredible response from supporters and Star Trek fans, and I want to thank you again for your kind messages and reaction to the film.

A NEW DOCUMENTARY!

ENTERPRISE BRIDGE CALLING ALL KICKSTARTER SUPPORTERS!
It’s just TWO WEEKS until our public release of the much-awaited-and-anticipated documentary “For The Love Of Spock,” and I’m about as excited as Spock was when he discovered Kirk was alive in "Amok Time!"
JIM!!!
